We've always trusted each other with things, and she did act flirtatiously sometimes, but it didn't feel like our relationship was going in that direction. Sure we were good friends, but she never once suggested she was looking for a boyfriend.

As I pondered the reason behind Phoebe's private social call, I walked through the house and into the front yard, where my bike was propped up against the side of the house. It was the same red bike I'd been taking around with me for nearly five years, and it got me everywhere I wanted to go.

The ride was short, and a few minutes saw me leaning my bike against Phoebe's porch several streets away. Her house was a two floor structure, with many slanted roofs crowning the stony walls. To my right was the tall garage, which I'd seen from time to time and it actually looked a lot cleaner than our own. The porch was a few square meters, with one of those hanging benches on the left beside the window.

Mounting the wooden platform, I got a wiff of the well-grown flowers that were planted in the garden I passed through earlier, along with the earthy smell of dirt and grass. My strapped sandals padded loudly against the porch, and a loud classical ding-dong noise was heard as I pressed the ringer.

Drawn by the doorbell, the sound of bare feet came from the other side of the entrance, stepping quickly. They stopped, and as the door swung inwards I caught sight of Phoebe standing there, smiling warmly at me. Before I could say anything she embraced me, drawing me in close.

"Thanks for coming," she whispered into my ear, as she rested her head against my shoulder. I was happy to let the moment last a little longer. When she released me, she took my hand and led me inside, me closing the door behind us.

A sleeveless blue blouse hugged her chest and shoulders, ending just below her ribs and showing off quite a bit of belly. Her shoulder-length brown hair shimmered in the sunlgiht, which was cast through the windows, and smelled like the flowers outside. White booty shorts swayed with her hips, complimenting her nice ass. The hand that pulled me was manicured, her purple nails sharp and filed, and her nice smooth legs led down to two pretty bare feet.

"Have a seat, I'll get us something to drink," she told me, leading me to the kitchen counter. She gestured to one of the stools and walked towards the fridge.

I grabbed her hand before she could leave. "It's okay, I'll get it," I offered.

"You're so sweet, but really, it's fine," I was reassured.

Relinquishing my grasp on her, I sat down and she opened the fridge. After pouring us some juice, she sat down on a stool next to me and explained our options while I sipped at the refreshing liquid.

"I've got everything I need if we're heading out. There's a clearing in the woods I found, secluded and alone. Also there's a nice place by the river where we could picnic. Or if you'd like, we could just stay here."
113.title: Popular Phoebe

choices: A great big bear, on its haunches and staring at us!
A woman wearing some sort of medieval clothing?
1131.content:
Downing my juice quickly, I smiled at Phoebe, "Let's hit the forest."

She nodded her head, her azure eyes sparkling in the window's light. "I was hoping you'd say that! It's a great little place... almost like the entrance to some fairy tale world."

I chuckled, taking my freshly-drained glass to the dish-washer. "Well, I hope we run across Sleeping Beauty. I gotta tell her to stop hanging with dwarves!"

Phoebe rolled her eyes at my terrible joke, but kept smiling. "That's Snow White, you dummy."

"Ehhh you sure?" I asked, scratching my head as if deep in thought. My friend responded with a playful shove.

"Honestly, I have no idea why I put up with you," she giggled, moving to the fridge to collect our picnic supplies. I glanced at her upthrust butt as she rumaged, ignoring the hormonal urges that told me to keep staring.

Me either, I replied in my mind. I was quite curious about this little excursion, due to the fact that Phoebe had never asked to be alone with me before. She had always been somewhat mysterious, but I wasn't one to look a gift horse in the mouth!

Soon, she had collected the supplies for our picnic, and we made our way to our bikes. I took one of the bags of food while Phoebe hooked the other onto her bike's handle. "Ready?" she asked, brushing her brown hair aside.

"I was born ready!" I growled, adjusting my bike.

"Good!" Phoebe smirked. "Let's see how fast you can ride, buddy!"

Instantly, she peeled down the street towards the forest. Never one to shirk a challenge, I bolted after her, admiring her taut body as she screamed down the street. She looked back with a laughing grin. "Is that it? You'll never catch me!"

Growling at the challenge, I pumped my legs harder, dodging parked cars and trash bins.

After a half-hour of riding, we were deep in the woods, well off of the riding trails. Tired but exhilirated, we emerged into a small clearing. Just as Phoebe had said, it was like something out of a fantasy novel. Almost perfectly circular, trees lined the edges of the strangely short grass. The air was hazy, and an occasional butterfly drifted lazily between the leaves.

"Pretty cool, huh?" Phoebe smiled, her blue blouse damp with sweat.

I nodded, breathing heavily. Hopping off of my bike, I set it down near the edge of the clearing. Kneeling down to pick up the picnic bag, Phoebe suddenly yelped.

Spinning on my heels, I looked to see...
1131.title: A Clearing of Mystery

choices: The air began to shimmer strangely...
The woman left us alone to ponder her weirdness
11312.content:
A woman emerged from the shrubs, wearing a strangely medieval-themed dress. It was a greenish-hue, and shimmered in the afternoon light. It had a plunging neckline revealing pinkish skin and amble bosom. Her face was angular, and almost... elfin? Startled, but mostly curious, I took a step forward.

But she spoke instead, raising a gentle hand. "I beseech you, young adventurers of the wooded glade. I have need of your talents."

Phoebe and I glanced at each other, our eyes narrowed with confusion.

"Uh, I think you may be lost," I muttered, trying to figure out if this woman was trying to play a trick on us.

"Oh no, fair child of Adam. I know precisely what realm this is, and precisely whom you are," she smiled an aluring but curious smile. "Your arrival was foretold by the Prophet Xalos, and he has sent me here to ask for your aid."

I blinked stupidly. Foretold? Realm? Prophet? Just what was this woman on?

Phoebe took a step forward herself. I admired how she took charge, thrusting her finger at the woman. "Lady, we get it. You're some actress at a renaissance fair, and you need some poor saps to come and buy tickets. There's no need for all of this theater stuff."

I nodded, smirking at my gorgeous friend. "Yeah. If we feel like it, we'll check it out later. But now, we're about to have a picnic." I paused, dismissing the woman with a gesture.

"So thanks, but no thanks."

The strangely-clad woman continued to smile, and whispered softly, "The prophet does not falter in his weavings of fate..."
11312.title: Herald of a Prophet

choices: Take a route through the forest
113121.content:
It was just a glimmer overhead at first that neither me or Phoebe noticed for a moment, our attention too caught up with the woman before us. A purple sparkle overhead finally got our attention though, and both me and Phoebe felt our mouths drop open as the sky above us seemed to have turned a deep dark purple with tiny little lights flickering across it.

"The Prophet does not falter!" the woman cried out as a wind blew up, kicking up dirt and leaves around us as it started to swirl in a tornado pattern. "Even if I have to take you to our realm myself!" With that, she raised her arms and lightning shot across the small expanse of sky we were under.

I felt a hand grab onto mine and saw Phoebe holding on tightly while looking at me. "RUN!" she yelled, and I really didn't need to be told twice as we both tried to make a run for it from the clearing. We proved to be too late however, as the winds whipped against us and prevented us from running too far before tendrils of light came down from the purple mass and pulled me and Phoebe up towards it!

As I was pulled into the purple sky, I could only make out a burst of light and a strong tingling sensation all over my body as Phoebe and I were completely enveloped. I had to shut my eyes as the light turned bright enough to hurt them. I don't know how long we were in the space between time and dimensions, but eventually I felt the wind on my back and opened my eyes just in time to be dropped unceremoniously to the ground. I landed with a grunt onto some thankfully soft grass and took a moment to get my bearings.

Looking around, I saw that I was in another forest clearing similar to the one we had just left, although I saw a dusty road in the distance, showing that I was not at home. The trees around me also looked different with plenty of vines hanging down from them, so thick as to obscure the sight of the rest of the forest in the distance. Sitting up with a groan, I saw Phoebe in a similar state in front of me and I let out a sigh of relief that she's OK.

Getting to my feet, I shakily walked over to Phoebe, still feeling the effects of going through that portal or whatever it was, and helped her to her feet "Thanks," she said, looking as dizzy as I felt. "You OK?"

"Yeah," I replied, shaking away the cobwebs. "You?"

"Been better," she said with a grim smile before looking around and giving a shiver. "This place is giving out one weird feeling," she said and I had to agree. There was a tingle in the air that I couldn't quite place, but it left goosebumps on my skin. "Won't get any answers here I suppose," Phoebe said, pulling me from my thoughts. "Let's see if we can find someone who isn't the crazy witch who sent us here."

Looking around, I looked for a way to head off. The path was clear but it might lead us directly to the woman who'd brought us here. But we could get lost in the forest if we took that way... Eventually, Phoebe and I decided too...
113121.title: The air began to shimmer strangely...

1131212.content:
Clearly, something both remarkable and terrifying had just brought us here. Venturing into the forest seemed like a no-go, considering the odd feeling both of us had about it. Sticking to the path, although possibly leading us to the witch, was still the best plan.

"That woman must have sprayed us with some sort of hallucinogen, or stunned us with a chemical. What we just saw... it wasn't real, was it?" Phoebe said in a bewildered tone.

I shrugged. "Beats me. I don't feel hung-over or anything, and it certainly felt real." I didn't want to mention the word 'magic', but it was clearly something supernatural.

My friend straightened her blue blouse, now covered with grass stains, and pointed to the dusty path. "Let's just get our bearings. We can worry about that crazy woman once we figure out where we were dumped."

I nodded, and led the way. The forest was much different than the one we were planning our picnic in. The trees enclosed the edges of the trail tightly, and thick vines weaved through the gaps like curtains. If I didn't know any better, I'd say the plant-life was actively blocking our sight. I didn't mention my thoughts to Phoebe, although I did glance back at her occasionally. Her brown hair was slightly mussed, and her blue eyes looked concerned, but she was still the image of a beauty.

Distracted, I clumsily tripped over a root and landed facefirst in the dirt.

"Ow. Son of a bee!" I muttered. It was more of an injury to my pride than anything, and Phoebe helped pull me up. Once I was back on my feet, I noticed a sign enveloped in the vines.

Phoebe noticed it too, and read it aloud: "Darkmoon Graveyard... Beware."

Rubbing my skinned elbow, I repeated the words. "Beware? Must be private property or something."

"Or.. something much worse. I really don't like this place." Phoebe hugged her body. "Maybe this was a bad idea."

Yeah, probably, I thought to myself. But I couldn't show weakness now, despite the fear I was feeling.

"We need answers, Phoebe. We can't just hang out in this forest all day. We have to find that woman and set things right."

Phoebe nodded, but concern was etched across her face. We reluctantly continued down the path, until...
1131212.title: Fear in the Woods

choices: Look for someone on their own
11312122.content:
I had to admit I was more than a little relieved at coming across a village rather than a graveyard. After what had already happened today, the last thing me or Phoebe needed was to spend time in a place like that. The trees pulled apart to show that the village was sandwiched between the forest behind us and a river just past the buildings with clear fields after that. Phoebe stepped forward a few times as she sank in the sight before her and then let out a sigh. "This isn't a hallucination, is it?" she asked in a resigned tone.

"Doesn't feel like it," I admitted, although I wasn't about to voice all of my fears just yet. Phoebe looked downhearted at this and I wrapped my arm around her shoulders to give her some comfort. "Look, we'll go ask someone for help. There's bound to be someone who can lend us a hand." I gave Phoebe a squeeze for reassurance and she gave a weak smile in response.

"OK, we'll go ask," she said although I could see she wasn't as optimistic as she was trying to be and I honestly couldn't blame her. We walked into the village in silence. It was a collection of several dozen wooden buildings that looked rather picturesque and quite clean, like a postcard you got from a Medieval show or something similar. We soon found the village center, a large space between some of the larger buildings in the village and my eye was drawn to a series of six sets of stocks that were grouped close together. From the looks of the grooves on them and the seats that people sat on while in them, it looked as if they were used on a regular basis.

Tearing my eyes away from them, I felt Phoebe grasp my arm and point towards a large building. "Sounds like we'll meet people in there," she said as I listened carefully and heard a ruckus coming from the building. A sign hung above the door showing a crown balanced on a feather, pointing towards the place perhaps being a pub or tavern of some kind. Phoebe started to walk towards it but I held out my arm. "Wait."

"What?"

"We don't know what we're getting into here," I said. "Maybe we should look around some more and find one person to speak with rather than a huge crowd. We are strangers here after all."

Phoebe looked at the pub longingly before saying "But that's the only place we know there's people. You want to risk running into that woman again?"

A fair point I thought and the two of us went back and forth over what to do until we eventually decided to...
11312122.title: We reached a small village

choices: We decided to make a run for it
We decided to talk it out
113121221.content:
The smell of roasted pork and bitter ale hit us as we opened the heavy door to the tavern. It was warm and dry inside the building, probably due to the massive fire nestled against one of the wooden walls. Resembling a medieval long-house, it was oddly cozy inside, with huge log rafters holding the wide roof above the dirt floor.

"...and I say we take up our weapons and defy the monsters!" shouted a gruff voice from somewhere inside the structure. Phoebe nudged me, and pointed to a crowd that had gathered at one end of the pub. Apparently no one had noticed our entrance.

"You would have the demons burn our village to ashes then?" replied an equally fierce sounding man from the same group. "It is better to accept our fate, appease the demons, and live in safety. It is a small price to pay." Some voices agreed with the statement.

There was clearly a serious debate going on, and from the bewildered look Phoebe gave me, she was as equally confused as to its content. "Demons?" I whispered to Phoebe's blank stare.

"It is easy for you to say that, Harwald, when it is not your daughters who must be presented to the demons every night! My young ones must take turns being... tormented... by those hideous creatures!"

The man identified as Harwald responded. "It is a burden, of no question, Finberg, but there is no harm done. A few hours of harmless sacrifice and the whole village is safe for another night. We would all agree that if the demons accepted one of us elders, we would jump at the chance. But you know that the creatures will only accept a youth for the sacrifice."

"Harmless!" shouted Finberg, chuckling sarcastically. "Do not mistake their laughter for mirth, my dear fellow. My daughters are positively exhausted by the dawn, touched and teased as they are by the demons that stalk our woods. Every youth that endures a night in the stocks would agree that it is not mere harmless fun!"

I was beginning to piece together the situation in this bizarrely-medieval themed town. But I had a hard time believing what exactly these people meant by 'demons'. Surely it was some sort of Halloween prank? I noticed Phoebe was nodding as we listened in.

"These people... or actors?... must present their children to some sort of ritual every night. It sounds really..." Phoebe paused, her eyes lost in deep thought.

I was hoping she would say 'exciting', but I bit my tongue. I stole a quick glance at her taut stomach, imagining it swaying to some quickly dancing fingers. Was I a bad friend for thinking such devious thoughts? Probably, but I didn't have time to regret it, because that was when the crowd turned to look at us!

"Hello," I muttered, waving pathetically at the crowd of peasant-folk. Their faces were grimy and their clothes were well-worn, but their eyes seemed to sparkle at our presence.

"What in the name of Theras the Overking are these two?" The man named Finberg asked, rubbing his deep-set eyes.

"Their garb is foreign," wondered Harwald, to agreeing voices. "And quite hideous. Perhaps they are vagrants from the East?"

I was about to say 'it takes one to know one', but decided to keep quiet.

"I think we may have solved our little problem, Harwald," muttered Finberg, his grime-soaked face scanning us greedily.

Phoebe and I shared a quick glance, noticing the crowd rapidly advancing on us.
113121221.title: A Village's Sacrifice

choices: "Strange girl, you will take the place of tonight's sacrifice."
"Search the forest and find the source of the demons."
1131212212.content:
I was about to turn tail and make a run for it, but I noticed Phoebe was standing her ground. I usually appreciated her assertiveness, but with a rapidly-advancing group of dirty peasants approaching, I wasn't so happy about it.

"Now, what is going on here?" My brown-haired friend asked, standing firmly with her hands on her hips. "Who are you people? What is this place? What are these demons?"

I could see the peasants were momentarily confused by her bombardment of questions. The man named Harwald, a very ugly man made uglier by his fat paunch, decided to answer.

"We are besieged by darkness, girl. You heard our stories, and you understand our dilemma. The demons are spawned from beyond our world and do not reason with us. They simply want what they want." He looked to his fellow peasants. "And they want our young ones, every night."

Sad voices echoed his statement. "They arrived two fortnights ago," he continued, "Their emissary, a strange woman of unholy looks, told us their demands. Whether she controlled them or was enslaved by them, we don't know. But she told us that the demons would destroy us if we refused."

A strange woman? Was it the witch that had brought us here? She clearly had some powers... summoning demons didn't seem so far-fetched for her.

"But why?" Phoebe asked, clearly a little shaken by the peasant's sad tale.

The man named Finberg, a tall and lanky man, shook his head. "We don't know, and we don't have the means to find out. All we know is that they come from the woods, and they desire one thing..."

I spoke up, feeling noble. "Maybe we can help? Maybe we can find the source of the demons? Or the woman who speaks for them?"

Some of the villagers nodded, and others looked confused.

"There is one sure way you can help..." said Finberg darkly, eying Phoebe's young body.

"Or...I could help search for the witch..." she murmured, blushing at the suddenly aggressive looks she received.

Harwald spoke with authority...
1131212212.title: They Want What They Want

choices: In a pair of stocks, with Phoebe stocked next to me!
In a peasant's bedroom, overlooking the village square
11312122121.content:
Both me and Phoebe were flabbergasted.

"Now wait just a minute here," I said, coming to the defense of my friend. "She's not going to be doing anything-"

Instantly, the crowd of peasants swarmed us, their grimy hands grabbing and pulling. With Finberg and Harwald leading, they managed to push me aside and Phoebe was lost in the sea of bodies.

"Phoebe!" I shouted futilely. I heard her shouting and cursing, but in my face was half a dozen medieval peasants, sneering and blocking me.

"Just stand aside, boy," threatened one unnamed villager, his teeth yellow and crooked. "If you knows whats-good-fer-ya, you'll let Finny and Har do their job."

"What kind of village is this!?" I shouted in his face. "You're nothing but a pack of kidnappers!"

A fist, perhaps his or another's, slammed into the side of my head. Dazed, I stumbled against the tavern wall. "Phoebe..." I mumbled as darkness quickly overtook me.

I awoke...
11312122121.title: Grab and Smash

choices: Dark figures emerged from the woods
The door to the room unlocked, and someone entered
113121221212.content:
With a sore head, I blinked awake. What the hell had just happened?

The smell of dust and mildew wafted over me, and I realized I was in a very rustic-looking room. The walls were wooden and decorated with items that wouldn't look out of place in a history museum. Apparently, after the villagers cold-cocked me, they were sweet enough to dump me in a straw bed. How nice.

Throwing off the covers, I staggered to my feet. The room had a single door which had a heavy padlock on it, meaning I was stuck. There was a small round window at the opposite end of the room. Perhaps I could smash it and climb down?

Using the walls for balance, I ventured across the creaky floor and peered out the viewport. The glass was dirty (much like everything and everyone in this hellhole) but I could see that center of the village was below. And to my chagrin, I realized that the stocks were not empty!

Phoebe was locked into the middle stocks, and she squirmed continuously against the bonds. Her hands and head were secured at an even level, and her back and rear-end were protruding from the wooden frame. It certainly wasn't appropriate considering the circumstances, but I couldn't help but admire the view. I quickly dismissed the thought. I had to figure some way to free her before the demons came. On our way into the village, I had noticed that the stocks were extremely well-crafted... they could probably take a lot of punishment. She wouldn't be able to get out on her own, so it was up to me.

With little time to waste, I looked around the room for something to smash the window. I wasn't going to let my good friend be tormented by anything! Unfortunately, I realized that the window was almost directly over Phoebe. If I smashed it, shards of glass would rain down on her... not something I wanted to happen.

I was helpless, and dusk was falling quickly. I tried to tap the window to get Phoebe's attention, but she couldn't look up if she wanted to. These sadistic villagers had thought of everything!

I resigned myself to watch Phoebe, hoping that perhaps this was all just an elaborate prank. However, something happened...
113121221212.title: A Room with a View

choices: Larger figures emerged from the darkness
1131212212121.content:
I could scarce believe my eyes when I noticed some movement near the edge of woods. The dim torchlights of the village seemed to falter, and shadows began to move amongst the trees. Phoebe, still stuck in the stocks below, froze in her struggles... and she craned her neck to look around. Clearly, she had seen the same movement that I had. Unfortunately, she was in the front row, while I remained in the bleachers.

I rubbed as much of the grime from the window as I could, but it was still too dark to make out any clear shapes. But there was no doubt about it, there were things out there. Things that moved as no human could.

"Damn this village," I said, cursing my luck. Of all the places to wind up, why did it have to be a medieval village besieged by demons?

Continuing to watch the village courtyard, I focused my sight near one of the torches. A small halo of light, about ten yards from Phoebe, seemed to have smallish figures dancing around the edges, as if they were avoiding the light. Suddenly, one of the figures dashed through the light, revealing a greenish blur. I didn't get as good a look as I had hoped but I saw something. It seemed about the size of a small monkey, and hopped and skipped with the same enthusiasm. But when the light reflected its skin, it wasn't furry... it was leathery.

I heard a shrill cry from Phoebe, somewhat muffled by the building I was in. She had seen the same thing I had.

I continued to watch below as my heartbeat accelerated. Another of the tiny creatures dashed through the light, revealing a bit more of its nature: it was a spindly thing, with a leathery hide and a jagged snout. But my main focus was on its thin tail. Nearly a yard in length, it ended in a pointed prong.

"What the hell was that?" I heard myself say.

A voice from behind startled me. "And what do you know of hell, outlander?"

I turned on my heels, and a peasant woman stood in the doorway to the room. Her face was serious and calm, but not without a hint of worry.

"What are those things?" I shouted at her, with my voice nearly breaking.

The peasant woman answered softly. "They are the first ones to come. The imps. The weakest and stupiedest of the Dark Horde. They are child-like in their curiosity, and merciless in their fury."

I barely heard the words as I returned to the window. The courtyard was swarming with the creatures, some dancing in the shadows, some openly running through the torchlight, but all were closing in on Phoebe...
1131212212121.title: Dancing in the Shadows

11312122121212.content:
A sudden gust of wind went through the village, the torchlight flickering as the fires wavered from the blast of air. The imps stopped short and went silent at the sudden wind and slowly started to move away from Phoebe, forming a circle around her. One side had a gap, making room for something else. I went to question the peasant woman behind me about this when I saw a figure coming from out of the darkness, as well as Phoebe ceasing her struggles to peer at the sight.

At first, I thought it was a person coming from out of the darkness. But when they stepped into the light I heard a gasp from behind me. I looked towards the peasant woman, whose face had gone pale. "A succubus!" she whispered in horror as I looked back to the figure. My initial impression had been wrong as the figure was certainly not a human. She was tall, standing a full head above an average man. Her skin was a dark blue, almost black, and there was a lot showing as she was wearing little more than a dark leather bikini with shoulder pads, not offering much in the way of modesty, a long dark cape flowing behind her. Jet black hair flowed down her back, and her beautiful face was in a serene expression as she gazed at Phoebe.

The succubus stepped into the circle of imps and smiled as she looked at Phoebe. Suddenly I was hit with a wave of warmth over my body. I gasped as I felt a tingle in my loins and the peasant woman yanked me back from the window. She must have burst into the room once she realised what was happening down in the village square. "Don't look directly at her!" she ordered. "She's a succubus! Simply looking at her can eventually drive anyone wild with desire!"

Considering the warmth I felt all over my body, I had to admit that it seemed entirely plausible, and I turned to look at the woman. "Who are you anyway?" I demanded. "What's going to happen to Phoebe?"

"My name is Celina," she replied before peeking over my shoulder. "And if your friend is lucky, then the worst that shall happen to her this night is hours of laughter and frustration."

"And if she's unlucky?" I demanded.

Celina went silent at that and her expression was pained. "If the tales from the rest of the realm are true, she could very well be taken by the Dark Horde."

The way in which she said the last sentence filled me with dread at what could happen to Phoebe if she was left in the stocks. But even if I got out of here, I didn't know what I could do to help her. The imps were dozens in number and it would be difficult getting out of this room without Celina alerting everyone. I looked back through the window and saw the succubus was now standing directly in front of Phoebe, my friend's face having an odd flush on it that indicated she was falling under the power of this demoness.

After a moment's thought, I decided to...
11312122121212.title: Mistress of Desire

choices: Prepare for war on my own
113121221212121.content:
The sheer power of the demoness had nearly overtaken me, and I was a fair distance away from her. Phoebe would be helpless, forced to gaze upon the succubus and all her diabolical beauty!

I chanced a quick look at the scene below. The succubus was peering over my trapped friend, examining her with cold indifference. I noticed a long slender tail, not unlike that of the imps, dart back and forth from beneath her cape. The dim torchlight impeded my vision, but I could see the voluptuous shape and sensuous curves of the demon even from my vantage point. It was unreal how the mere sight was increasing my blood rate and arousing... other parts of me. If the effect was the same on Phoebe... I shuddered at what she must be experiencing so close to the demonic aura.

I suddenly felt Celina's strong hands cover my eyes. "You fool! Don't look upon the creature!"

I half-heartedly fought her off, but I knew that I had to look away. "Fine. But tell me everything! What that thing is, and what's going to happen to my friend?"

"Very well," the peasant woman said, removing her hands from my face and sighing. "It's the least we can do, considering the horrible things we've already done to you."

Her face was weathered, but held a certain beauty. Green-grey eyes sparkled in the candlelight. "You see, outlander, the Dark Horde is what you see in our town. Imps, succubi, minotaurs... and other, worse things... they are ravaging our realm, and no one knows their source. All we know is that they first appeared in the eastern swamps, and have spread far and wide in the past months. They do not destroy us, provided we offer them gifts. Gifts such as your young companion."

She looked down at the scene below for a moment, and quickly looked away.

"But why can't you fight them? Don't you have soldiers? Or weapons?"

Catherine smiled a cruel smile. "Fear runs rampant in these lands. Perhaps it is the work of the Legions of Darkness, but the fact is that no army dares raise a sword against them."

I thought for a moment, remembering the fear in the eyes of Finberg and Harwald. "But didn't some villagers want to fight? Why can't you organize a militia?"

"I fear the men are no warriors. Whoever takes up arms against the demons loses their nerve within moments... it's almost as if they can exude terror into their enemies." She looked thoughtful for a moment. "Perhaps just as the succubus produces her aura of desire, the other demons produce auras of fear?"

I nodded. As ridiculous as it sounded, there was a certain logic to it. What better way to keep your enemies subdued than to keep them cowardly?

"But you have to do something, and I can't leave Phoebe down there!" I was frustrated with these villagers. Magical aura of fear or no, I had to do SOMETHING.

Celina spoke gravely. "It appears that your friend won't be down there for much longer." She was peering through the window, with a worrying expression. She motioned for me to look, and I braced myself for the blast of desire from the succubus.

But, strangely, the stocks were now empty! Phoebe was nowhere in sight! "What the hell-?" I started to say, before Celina pointed to the distant tree line.

Two figures stood in the dim light, just on the edge of town. One was obviously the succubus, with her great height and well-shaped curves. And the other was Phoebe! She was walking slowly behind the succubus, almost as if in a trance, surrounded by happily-dancing imps. I then noticed the long black rope that hung around Phoebe's neck, being held by the succubus. My friend was apparently now a willing pet of the demoness.

"Oh God," I said, as the whole host of demons disappeared into the forest.

Celina shook her head. "No gods are here, outlander. Just evil."
113121221212121.title: The Dark Horde's Power

choices: We arrived at the demoness' lair
1131212212121211.content:
There was no time to lose, I couldn't let Phoebe be taken away by the demon host without trying something! I turned around and pushed past Celina, who offered little resistance. I made my way through the open door and down the stairs of the tavern, which appeared to be empty. I guessed that the village people were mostly hiding in their homes rather than face the demoness themselves.

         A hill loomed before us, it's size or details hidden beneath the carpet of brush and covering of trees. The only outstanding detail in the mossy bank were a set of wooden double doors, without any visible handle, every inch of their worn faces covered in strange symbols. Legend says that a strong... holy... presence is hidden within. In ancient times, it's been used as a place of worship. Perhaps there's something there that can help you?"

Well, it wasn't an army, but it was something, I thought. Nodding at Celina, I turned away. The old graveyard was just outside of town. I vaguely remembered how to get there, and I would have to hurry. If Phoebe had truly been seduced by the succubus, the longer I took to free her, the harder it would be to break the spell. This shrine was the last best hope I had.

I made my way down the stairs into the hall of the now-deserted pub. A faint smell of spit-roasted pork hung in the air. It enraged me to think that these peasants had enjoyed a fine meal while my friend had been taken by demons.

Using my rage to hurry my pace, I left the pub and headed towards the graveyard...
1131212212121212.title: Alone into the Darkness

choices: It was memories of an ancient war
It was a vision of Phoebe in the future
11312122121212121.content:
The graveyard was far eerier than anything I was expecting. With the threat of demons lurking in the shadows, and nothing but simple moonlight to guide my path, I emerged into the massive cemetery with a small inkling of where to look. Apparently, I was looking for some sort of holy shrine. I assumed there was some sort of statue of an angel or something, but all I could see were endless rows of weather-beaten headstones. Vines and weeds had overtaken much of the stonework.

Wandering through the sinister-looking graveyard was causing my blood to run cold. Just as I was about to turn tail and return to the village, I spotted a figure in the distance. Half-covered in dark vines, I could barely pick out the features in the dim light. But I realized that the figure was a statue, overlooking a rather curious altar.

Just looking at the statue set my mind at ease... as if it were emitting some sort of calming aura. I approached carefully, and noticed that the likeness was a woman. The stonework was practically enveloped in vines and plants, as if trapping the statue. I reached out a hand to begin removing some of the plant material...

A shock went through to my very bones! But it wasn't like static electricity, it was more like a shock of images and sounds and thoughts. My brain was overwhelmed with memories (or was it visions of the future?) of a lost time and lost souls.

I staggered back from the statue, and tried to sort the images into sense...
11312122121212121.title: Holy Visions

choices: And saw more visions of Phoebe
113121221212121212.content:
Strangely enough, the vision seemed to be of Phoebe... as if it were a scrapbook assembled from various points in time. The first image appeared to be of Phoebe back in middle school. I remembered that she always been a looker, and that she was the most popular kid in school. I thought it was odd how she had always hung out with me, even when the other girls would mock me for my short stature or nerdish physique. Images of Phoebe playing games with me and consoling me brought back some raw emotions.

But those early visions were muddied. Vivid images of my friend flashed before me again, and they sent a chill down my spine.

Phoebe was again with the Succubus, trailing her, surrounded by a gaggle of yipping imps. I realized that this vision was from mere moments ago. The Succubus, in all of her demonic voluptuousness, was happily guiding my friend through the bramble and undergrowth. The rope was still around Phoebe's neck, and a gentle tug from the demoness urged her to continue. It was clear that my friend was dazed... an imp would occasionally jump to probe Phoebe's bare legs, resulting in her yelping with a giggle. The Succubus would scold the little imp, only for another of the nasty little creatures to do the same moments later.

As if fast-forwarding a DVD, the images suddenly changed, and no longer was Phoebe in the forest. Instead, she was within a ghastly demonic harem of sorts. Demons, both Succubus and Minotaur, and other indescribable creatures were wandering around, chatting, laughing and doing all sorts of demonic things. Human women, captured villagers mostly, were dressed as harem slaves, and were walking between the demons, giving food and drink, or merely kneeling as pets to their various demon owners. Phoebe, dressed in a barely-there chain bikini, lay at the feet of the Succubus, oblivious to the goings-on around her.

It was clear to me that this vision was not set in stone. While it seemed real enough, some strange voice whispered that I could change it.

I kept my hand on the statue...
113121221212121212.title: A Grim Future

choices: Push deeper into the vision, and view it from Phoebe's perspective
Withdraw from the vision and begin searching for Phoebe
1131212212121212121.content:
The visions continued, but grew more vivid and alive. I don't know if it was because of my strong emotional connection to Phoebe, or simply a factor of the time I was spending touching the statue, but it seemed as though I could almost feel and smell the scenes. Strangely enough, I felt my heartbeat fall in synch with Phoebe's...

The harem was grostesquely ornate, with red draped curtains and crimson-colored walls lining the room. A sinister orange glow emanated from somewhere unseen, highlighting everything with a hellish light. Definitely something a demon would appreciate. Interestingly, there were metal rings and chains dangling in strategic locations... presumably to restrain the various slaves that would brought in.

I detected a faint smell of sulfur mixed with perfume. The demons themselves were a mixed bunch. Most were humanoid, although there were a couple of strange blobs and eyeballs floating about that seemed to be taking part. Succubi and Minotaurs seemed have the most numbers, with imps and gremlins joined among them. I had to say, for a bunch of creatures from hell, they sure seemed to appreciate their diversity!

And of the human slaves, there were probably fifteen or so. They were all quite beautiful and young, dressed in mostly skimpy (but richly detailed) clothing. It seemed like half of them were owned by individual demons, while the rest appeared to be servers. The ones owned by demons were dressed according to their master's tastes. The Succubi preferred their slaves in jewelry and metal, with intricate runes embedded with gems and gold. The Minotaurs seemed less concerned with 'fancy' stuff, and their slaves were dressed in simple leather, with various straps and buckles over their mostly bare bodies.

Phoebe, since her mistress was a succubus, was dressed in a very scandalous outfit. Her taut body was accentuated by the silver metal bra that hugged tightly to her skin. It was designed with a spiral-like shape and studded with rubies and sapphires, and a veil of chainmail dangled from beneath her pushed-up breasts. She had a matching set of metal bikini briefs that left very little to the imagination. Her hair was braided into a tight, high-sitting ponytail. Miscellanous bracelets and necklaces pressed against her soft skin. As selfish as it was, I was entranced by the exposed body of my captured friend.

Phoebe was half-sprawled at the feet of the succubus, while her mistress was conversing with a minotaur and a floating eyeball. The minotaur, a grey-black beast standing at least 8 feet high, had a slave of his own: a blonde-haired villager. Thicker and more voluptuous than Phoebe, she was wearing leather straps at strategic positions on her tanned body. It seemed the minotaur didn't quite trust his slave, as the blonde villager had a leather leash tied around her neck. Phoebe had no such restraint. Perhaps the Succubus's powers of seduction made it pointless?

In any case, I couldn't quite hear what the demons were discussing. I wondered if I could push myself deeper into the vision, and perhaps experience it from Phoebe's perspective? It might give me some clue as to where to look for her...
1131212212121212121.title: A Vision of Slavery

choices: "We might have something that can help..."
11312122122.content:
I flinched at that command and from the look on Phoebe's face. She hadn't been hoping that'd be the option given to us either. The villagers around us nodded in agreement and murmured their assent, that we would be the ones to go out and hunt for the witch and her demon band. I wondered about protesting but realised that doing that would only make things worse. "Where in the forest? We're not exactly local you know and it looked like a pretty big place to us."

Whatever hope I had in thinking that protest would quash their demands died once a man behind the bar of the tavern pulled a piece of paper from underneath the wooden platform and passed it over to Finberg. The tall man walked over to us and opened the paper up, showing it to be a map of the village and surrounding area. "This here is where we think the witch's lair is." Finberg said, pointing his finger down to a very large area circled on the map some miles north to the village. "Three young ladies of the village strayed there just before the witch made her demands. Two of them were captured and haven't been seen since," he said bitterly. "The last managed to give us the location but fear for our lives has stayed our hands. If you find the lair and come back to report its location, then we can think about launching an assault."

Well, it was risky to say the least. Phoebe grabbed a hold of the map and looked at it, her lips pursing in thought. "Not a lot to go on here," she said with a hint of annoyance.

"It's all we have lass," Finberg retorted. "You think we'd be sitting here chatting if we already knew where the lair was? Now unless you want to be out on those stocks tonight, and every night, instead of our own, you best get searching. And don't think running away will do you any good either. The witch has familiars that can, and will, track you down."

"Lovely," I muttered darkly as Phoebe rolled up the map and placed it into her pocket. I had to admire her more than ever at this point. She looked ready to brave danger, and I wasn't going to let her down. "I don't suppose you have any weapons or armour to help defend ourselves?" I asked, wanting some sort of protection at least.

The villagers glanced around at each other, silence reigning for a moment before Finberg turned back to us and replied...
11312122122.title: A Witch Hunt

113121221221.content:
"We might have something that can help..." Finberg replied.

He then turned and pulled out an unlit torch from behind the wooden counter of the bar, took a few steps over to a lit torch, held in one of the sconces embedded into the tavern's walls, and lit the new torch in his hand. The man then looked back at Phoebe and me, standing close to the bar at this point.

"Follow me." He grunted out, then came out from behind the bar and started walking toward the back of the inn to a small, unsuspecting wooden door.

The door opened to revel a stone staircase, likely to the cellar, I mused in my head. As the man descended the stairs, I followed after him. Phoebe held on to my arm as we went down into the darkness, partly for reassurance, and partly for balance.

It wasn't until we had been walking for more than a minute that I started to realize this "cellar" was much, much deeper than I first imagined.

Finally after what felt like hours, we finally reached the bottom of the stairs, which ended as a narrow tunnel. As we followed Finberg and his torch, I saw the passage way open up to what appeared like a massive natural cave. The room was cool, being deep into the ground, far from the sun's warmth. But beyond the chill, there seemed to be a sort of energy, almost like a static sensation which made my hairs stand on end.

Finberg stuck the torch into a sconce that had been put in the wall, likely long ago judging from the rust that the metal had on it. The cave itself was surprisingly light, albeit dimly lit by softly illuminated green stones that sat in various positions in the walls of the cave. It wasn't until I looked up and saw a massive collection of the green stones in the middle of the ceiling, soft of reminiscent of a dim green sun, which provided most of the light in the room.

Finberg, while seeming somewhat apprehensive, perhaps feeling the same strange energy in the room, continued to walk further into the room, where in the middle sat a large stone. This upon closer inspection, turned out to be a large gray chest.

"This..." Finberg began to say, after stopping before the chest. "This is a treasure from my great grandfather's time. He was told by a prophet about an ancient prophecy that when an adventurer from a faraway land arrived in our town. That his would be that adventurer's great weapon and that with it, he would save us from the terrible darkness."

Finberg turned to us, before slowly opening the lid to the chest and sitting inside the chest I saw...
113121221221.title: "We might have something that can help..."

1131212212212.content:
Sitting inside the chest was an old leather-bound book, which would have looked normal if it weren't for a slight, almost imperceptive shimmer to it. On the cover the title of the book was etched into the leather. The cover read "Gargalesis Compendium", which was not a very reassuring title, but at the same time made me quite curious.

I reached down and picked up the book. The first thing I noticed was the leather book felt light, almost like a feather. The second was the strange feeling I felt when I entered the room, seemed to amplify tenfold, almost as if electricity were running through my body. Whatever this book was, it was powerful and more than likely dangerous.

"By the most holy..." I heard Finberg mumble to himself, taking a step back.

Apparently the strange feeling also grew in perceptibly considering when I looked up, Finberg stared at me with wide eyes, and Phoebe looked at me with a mixture surprise and confusion.

As I held the book, I began to feel a new sensation in my head, almost a tickling feeling. It started off almost imperceptible, but then all of a sudden hit me like a truck. All at once, I feel the room spin and turn black.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -----

I woke up with a slight headache, moaning as I tried to move. Slowly I managed to open my eyes partially and somewhat prop myself up.

"Where.. where am I?" I groaned out weakly into what seemed to be common room of the inn.

"Welcome back to the living, son." I heard a familiar grunt say.

Finberg walked over and helped me sit up against the wooden wall of the inn. Looking around I saw a few of the patrons from earlier looking at me. In fact there seemed to be more people than before I went into the cavern. Apparently whatever happened, word had got around.

"W-What happened down there...?" I crocked.

This caused Finberg to laugh a bit and rub the back of his head.

"I was hoping you could tell me lad." He said before continuing. "One minute you were standing there with the book, next thing I know, you fell over, then a bright light started coming out of it, then the book seemed to, well... enter you body."

"Entered my..." I started to say, partially in disbelief.

As I started to think about the book, suddenly I could see it. Somehow it was in my head, or more accurately the knowledge from the book was somehow absorbed into my brain.

It was that moment when I realized what the feeling in the cave was, what was now in my head. Magic.

The more I though about the book, the more things started to change. The world still looked the same, but at the same time, I could see things differently if I focused. I could see the people standing in front of me, but I could also see what made them up, their energy so to speak.I also felt that I could do things, a great tide of power was inside me and all around me, but it was shapeless, formless, a lot like water. This was only the beginning, I had only started to come into whatever weird powers I had acquired, the possibilities were endless!

Before I got too far into that line of thought, something struck me.

"Phoebe!" I exclaimed.

Where was Phoebe? What happened to her? Did the villagers plan on using her as a sacrifice? I started to feel a sense of panic welling up, that's when I heard...
1131212212212.title: Knowledge Is Power

choices: Run away as to somewhere else
113121221222.content:
"Well that's just terrific." I muttered darkly as I realised that Phoebe and me were about to be sent into a completely hostile environment with hardly any knowledge and even less chances to defend ourselves. Phoebe looked less than amused herself but we were unable to protest as we were soon both escorted harshly out of the tavern and towards the edge of the village.

Once we reached the outer houses of the village, the mob surrounding us stopped and Finberg was chosen to talk to us "Remember strangers, the witch has eyes and ears throughout the forest and the Demons she has at her command are ruthless. Try to flee and it shall only end with you being caught. Help us, and we shall in turn help you."

"Because you're doing such a great job of helping yourselves so far." Phoebe shot back before turning around and practically marching back to the forest. I looked back to the villagers and decided not to stick around as I quickly followed Phoebe. I felt the crowd's eyes stick with us as we reached the edge of the forest and it wasn't until we were swallowed up by the three that I knew no one was watching... overtly anyway.

Once we were alone, Phoebe slowed down her walk until she was dragging her feet "Some day with you this turned out to be." She muttered sadly "I didn't think this would happen. I didn't... I'm sorry."

I was surprised to see Phoebe, normally so strong, act like this and I quickly put an arm around her shoulder "It's not your fault." I insisted "We're going to get through this and we'll get back home, I promise you." I gave her an affectionate squeeze with my arm and she gave a soft smile in response.

After a moment of just standing together in silence, Phoebe patted my hand "Thank you." She said before looking around the trees and giving out a sigh "I hope we get out of this soon. This place is giving me the creeps."

The atmosphere around us was oppressive and there was a tingle in the air that felt unnatural. Might have been because we weren't from this realm but I got the impression there was something else at work here. It was then that I decided to go for broke "Why not just leave? They said we'd be hunted down but that could have just been them trying to scare us into doing their dirty work."

Phoebe considered this and we both weighed the options. Certainly had no reason to believe the villagers and running away might give us time to come up with another way to get out of here. But maybe by doing the task, we'd manage to track down the woman who'd sent us here.

After a few minutes of debate, we eventually decided to...
113121221222.title: Out in the Cold

choices: Phoebe gets pulled over by a police car.
We soon arrived at Phoebe's riverside area without incident.
1132.content:
The location didn't matter to me quite honestly, wherever we went would be fine. Phoebe was a good friend despite being so new to me, and it didn't hurt that she was incredibly hot - and wearing clothes to make sure I couldn't ignore the fact. Rump hugged by a pair of tight booty shorts with no legs at all, a sleeveless blouse with only a single button done across her chest and ending a good few inches above her navel. She had mastered the art of teasing without moving a muscle. "Whichever one you want, Phebe," I said. "I'm not too picky."

"Well then, be picky," she pouted, crossing her arms in front of her. They crossed right underneath her breasts, and I could have sworn she were lifting them slightly... "I've been trying to decide for the last ten minutes before you arrived, and I'm feeling indecisive today."

"In that case, what makes you think I can decide in ten seconds? You choose." I replied, knowing where this quibble would lead.

"No you." Her smile was beginning to fade, a look of frustration crossing her face.

"You," I replied.

"You."

"Nuh-uh, you."

"You!" With a loud stamp of her foot, she pushed her hands down onto her hips and thrust her chest out. "Why do you always have to do that! Stop being stubborn and choose!" Blood rushed to her cheeks as the cutest frown creased her brow, and her lips went into a pout that belong to a six year old.

"You're adorable, you know that?" Suddenly realizing that she'd done exactly what I'd expected, she swatted my arm and fumed even more. Eventually she calmed down though, blushing and smiling as I continued to chuckle. Placating her with gestures, I offered an olive branch. "Let's head to the river. Getting to see you in a swimsuit is always a good thing."

Phoebe giggled and nodded, getting over her embarrassment real quick. "Let's go get ready then!" she exclaimed giddily, taking me by the hand and leading me up to her room. I sat on her bed and watched as she bent over (was I imagining that her butt was swaying?) and rummaged through her drawers. After a surprisingly long time, she selected and pulling out a bikini to wear and a large t-shirt to cover it with. Standing up, she bounced over to her restroom and ducked behind the door, turning back toward me and winking.

"No peeping now!" she giggled, closing the door behind her.

Once she'd changed and come out, I foraged for some food and water while she gathered some towels a picnic blanket. The spot Phoebe had in mind was a bit of a distance away; it was too far to walk, so we hopped in her car and began driving over. We made small talk as she drove toward the edge of town, where the woods were.
1132.title: Headed for the riverside

choices: Create a new option. Tickle fight!
1133.content:
I thought about it for a minute. "I don't know, I'm a bit on the lazy side today, and didn't plan on going that far, so unless you really wanted to go out today, why don't we just stay here."

"You? Lazy? Naaaaah." She joked as she pinched my side, and made me giggle. "Nah, if you wanna stay here, that's perfectly fine with me. There's plenty of things to do around here. Besides, I did want to hang out alone, and what's more alone than the privacy of your own home? Why don't you stay down here, and get comfortable while I go upstairs, and get some stuff for hanging out here. Movies, board games, that sort of thing."

"Are you sure? I can come with you, and help you carry some stuff."

"No, that's okay. It'll ruin the surprise if you do that." I tilted my head. Surprise? She giggled at my confusion. "I'm sure you're curious as to why I've been so pushy about hanging out alone lately. Well it's a surprise. One that'll be ruined if you come up and help. So you just finish your juice, grab a snack if you want, and sit down on the couch when you're done. Alright?"

"Alright. If you insist, but this surprise better be a good one."

"Don't worry about it. You'll love it. Promise." Then she walked off, squeezing my hip, and making me squeal quietly as she went.

As I subtly watched her hips sway slightly as he she walked away, I briefly wondered if this surprise of hers was at all tickle related. She seemed a bit more tickly than normal, and it wasn't as if my fascination with it was a secret. In fact, it was probably the most well known factoids about me. Meanwhile, I had no idea where she stood on the subject. She wasn't totally adverse to it, as she had just shown, but it had somehow never been talked about, and I had never had much opportunity to even figure out how ticklish she even was.

Downing my juice quickly, I slipped off my sandals in the corner with the others shoes before walking into the living room, and plopping myself back down on her couch, still wondering on where Phoebe stood on tickling. Most likely, she was a casual enjoyer it. Enjoying dishing out or receiving brief tickles that last a few seconds, and even the occasional tickle fight. Of course, now that I thought about it, she seemed to avoid the subject. While we had never discussed it, she had been witness to me talking about it with other people, and never commented. Sometimes, she even changed the subject. This made me briefly consider the possibility that maybe she hated it. I dismissed the thought quickly. I had tickled her in the past, and she definitely didn't hate it. Of course, there was another possibility, a wonderful possibility, as to why she would avoid it. She could actually love it like I did. People often hid their fascination with tickling for fear of being judged.

Suddenly, I was broken out of my thoughts by manicured nails skittering across my soles, causing me to let out a quiet, but quite unmasculine shriek. "Well. That was certainly amusing." Phoebe snickered. "What were you thinking about that distracted you that much?"

What your stance on tickling is? I don't think so. "My surprise of course. I'm curious as to what it is."

She smiled warmly at me. "Patience. You'll find out soon enough. Anyway, I brought down a couple things that we could do."

"Alright, shoot." She pulled over a box and a movie case.

"The first thing we could do is watch this movie. Don't worry, it's not a chick flick. At least, I don't think it is. It's called 'Your Adventure In Ancient Greece'".

"Sounds like a documentary."

"Right? Supposedly it's a really good adventure movie though. The second thing we could do is play this weird board game that I found at a garage sale. 'Pero Veselo'"

I cocked my head. "Is that Russian?"

"Heck if I know. So what's it gonna be?"
1133.title: Stayed at Phoebe's place

choices: The room started to blur, and we woke up in a prison cell, in Ancient Greece
Pheobe plopped her bare feet up onto my lap
11331.content:
I thought about my choices for a moment. They both sounded interesting. However, we didn't know the rules of how to play, and if it wasn't an American game, then the instructions might not be in English. Which means we'd have to look them up, which could take awhile. Not including however long the game wore on. Plus, watching a movie meant sitting on the couch. Close enough for some intimacy.

"Let's watch the movie Pheobe. This 'adventure movie' piques my interest."

"Don't lie. You just want to be lazy and lie on the couch."

I leaned over and tickled her ribs for that, earning a very satisfying squeal as she fell back to get away.

"Why don't you set up the movie. I'll go get us some soda, and popcorn."

"Sounds good."

I walked into the kitchen, and put the popcorn in the microwave, before getting a big metal bowl to share from. While it was popping, I walked over to the counter, and as subtly as I could looked over toward Pheobe. As she was messing with the DVD player, he butt was sticking up a bit, and swaying slightly, while her feet we positioned, so I had full of the stretched out soles. I knew she hadn't seen me, but I couldn't help but feeling that both these things were for my benefit.

She started to stand up as the popcorn stopped, so I stepped away from the counter, put the popcorn into the metal bowl, grabbed two sodas, and headed out.

"You ready to start the movie?"

"You betcha. Popcorn smells good."

At that, we plopped down on the couch, put the sodas & popcorn on the ground so we could reach them easily, and hit play. As the movie started rolling . . .
11331.title: Your Adventure In Ancient Greece

113311.content:
All at once, the room around us started to blur, and both Phoebe and I were knocked out by the confusion. I woke up to a shocking realization. “Phoebe,” I announced. “We’re in a prison cell.”

“What?” Phoebe asked as she opened her eyes. “Wait! We’re in prison! How did we get here?”

“I don’t know,” I responded, surveying the cell and finding that it appeared to be from an ancient time. “The movie must have drawn us in here. This must be our ‘Adventure in Ancient Greece’; I can tell that this prison isn’t modern.”

“So the movie actually took us to ancient Greece?” Phoebe wondered. “That’s strange.” The two of us observed our situation, trying to get our bearings in this new place.

Once we had come to terms with our new situation, Phoebe and I looked down at ourselves to see what had happened to our clothes. Our outfits had somehow been changed so that we were both wearing a cheap linen that covered our upper bodies, but exposed a shoulder and armpit. In addition, we each had another linen that began at the hips and went down to our ankles, but we were both barefoot. We looked over each other and then I proclaimed, “Phoebe, we should probably try to get out of here. Prison doesn’t sound like much of an adventure to me.”

“You’re probably right,” Phoebe admitted. We started tearing apart the cell, and Phoebe found what appeared to be a metal shovel hidden under her bed. “Hey! I found something that we might be able to dig our way out with.”

“Good,” I stated. I checked under my bed, finding another shovel-like tool. “Let’s get out of here.” We both started digging near the back wall of our cell, and about fifteen minutes later,
113311.title: Prisoners in Ancient Greece

choices: Use the feathers on your feet
Use their nails on your feet again
1133112.content:
Phoebe and I were fifteen minutes into our escape plan when we heard, “Stop, prisoners!” Frantic, we dug faster as we heard the door to our cell unlock and open. Suddenly, I felt myself being pulled up, and I dropped my shovel. I turned around to see a guard, probably about twenty years old, holding me. Before I could try to get away, he pushed me to the ground and shackled my arms and legs together. I looked up and saw that another guard was restraining Phoebe. All at once, “We are taking them to the head guard.” I felt myself being pulled up, and the two guards slowly marched Phoebe and I outside of our cell to another guard, this one probably around thirty years old. “We caught these two trying to escape. What should we do with them?”

“Have Ladies Fern and Missy torture them,” the head guard ordered.

“Of course, sir,” my guard confirmed. “Let’s go!” Right after this, we were both taken to a different room, which had two tables with chains on them. I was pushed onto a table face up, and my wrist chains were undone, but before I could try to take down the guard, he locked my wrists to the chains on the table. In addition, my ankles were put in the table’s chains, and my top linen was pulled up to expose my stomach. I glanced at Phoebe, seeing that she was also tied on her back to the other table with her midriff exposed. Before long, two women dressed like you had been entered the room, each holding many feathers in their hands. “Ladies Fern and Missy, they are all yours. Let us know if you need anything.”

“I think we will be fine for now,” one of the women announced. “You may head outside the room. We will let you know if we require your assistance.” The guards departed, and one woman came up to each of us, with the one that had spoken coming up to me. “I am Lady Missy, and I will be your torturer for today. Are you from here? You look like foreign spies.”

“No, we are not from here,” you proclaim nervously. “This was supposed to be our ‘Adventure in Ancient Greece’, but for some reason we got put in prison.”

“I have heard about an ‘Adventure in Ancient Greece’ before,” Lady Missy declares, seeming to know something about the movie. “I suppose you are actually from the future and got here through a movie. Am I correct?”

“Yes,” you affirm, wondering how she knows this.

“Well, then the two of you are in the right place,” Lady Missy surprises you with this. “The movie is an interactive journey, and we are your guides. This will take up a couple hours back in your time, but in here, the typical journey is a few days, although some people take much longer. In the adventure, we show you all of the aspects of ancient Greece, and you begin at the bottom of the ladder in a Greek prison. Most of the adventurers try to escape, and while some succeed, most of them are captured. Naturally, a long torture is the punishment for an attempted escape, but we do not believe in harmful torture. Once we finish with you, we will take you out of the prison to continue your adventure. However, if you ever break a law, you will be brought back to the prison, and your journey will restart with more torture. "Yeah?" I responded, matching her grin with one of my own. A moment passed between us, just staring at each other, before I continued with "What about this?" and l leaned my head down and...

choices: "I've learned a dark secret about our families."
114.content:
Despite her withdrawn personality, Maddie could have rivaled any of the 'pretty' girls in school. Unfortunately, she often concealed her good looks with long bangs and heavy sweaters. I was the only one in class to see her true beauty; both on the outside and in her heart.

However, in recent months she had become far more anti-social than normal. While in the past we often walked to school together, lately she had been avoiding me... leaving for school at random times and cancelling our tutoring sessions. I was growing increasingly worried, and was preparing to confront her after school was over for the summer. But before I got the chance, she had appeared at my front door with a single message:

"Meet me at my house on the first day of summer break. Don't tell your parents or your sister."

I tried to ask what was going on, but Maddie bolted before I could speak a word. She had certainly peaked my curiosity with her bizarre behavior. I only hoped that it wasn't anything serious.

Finally, the day of our meeting was here. I slapped on a pair of shorts and a t-shirt, scarfed some cereal, and told my Mom I would be gone for the day. She merely nodded, and went back to whatever motherly task she had been working on. And since Maddie lived next door, she was merely yards away if I needed her.

Leaving out the backyard door, I sauntered over to the fence dividing our properties. With practiced ease, I scaled it and hopped onto Maddie's lawn. Approaching her patio door, I noticed it was slightly ajar. I assumed it was Maddie's way of saying, 'Welcome'.

Fully opening the sliding glass door, I entered into the cool air of Maddie's family room. I suspected that her family was more or less in the same financial position as my own as we shared similiar furniture.

"Hello? Maddie?" I called out. "You here?"

A response came echoing from the basement. "Come down here. Hurry!"

There was a strange urgency in her voice, so I half-walked, half-ran to the basement stairwell. Racing down into the damp cold of the half-finished cellar, I spotted Maddie sitting among a stack of cardboard boxes. Before I had even taken a step, she said...
114.title: Shy Maddie

1141.content:
I was somewhat taken back by the blunt proclamation by Maddie. In all my years, I’ve never had any reason to suspect something sinister from my family (or hers, for that matter).

“Dark secret?” I asked. “Such as…?

Maddie looked down at a small leather bound book she was holding, then back at me.

“I was always told that our family money came from international trade and shipping businesses.”

I nodded in agreement. That was what I was told as well.

“Well it turns out they are actually involved in a kidnapping racket!”

At this point I couldn’t help but laugh. I mean, kidnapping? Really?

“Maddie, that’s ridiculous. Your parents are some of the nicest people I know. And I can’t imagine my parents being involved in anything illegal.”

“I know how it sounds. And before I found this book, I wouldn’t have believed it either.”

I took another look at the old book Maddie was holding. It had worn edges and a faded cover. She opened it up to show me its contents.

“This shows how their operation works. A client contacts them with a job. Then both of our fathers pick up the victim using any means necessary; deception, coercion, even force. Then they take the victim to one of their holding facilities where they keep them for as long as the client wants.”

I read a page containing a list of holding facilities and the people charged with running them. I was in shock as I read the list of people who ran the nearest facility; it included Maddie’s mother, as well as my own!

“Look, this all seems a little unreal.” I said. “How do you know this isn’t just some piece of fiction?”

Maddie seemed to get upset. “Look, I called you over here because I thought you could help me. If it is true, then we need to expose it to the world. There are innocent people being imprisoned against their will!”

It looked like she might start to cry. I didn’t want to upset her, but she was kind of putting me on the spot. Ultimately, I decided it wouldn’t be fair to string her along, so I had to make a decision.
1141.title: The Family Secret

choices: A muffled grunt from behind some boxes?
11411.content:
The absurdity of the situation aside, I figured the least I could do was put Maddie's mind at ease.

"If our parents truly are international slave traders, then we need to do something about it." I tried to keep my voice serious, but I couldn't help but smirk on the inside. My parents? Kidnappers for criminal clients? I couldn't believe it for a second.

But Maddie smiled ever so slightly. While she had been a long-time friend of mine, I couldn't help but feel a tingle when I saw her smile. Perhaps this situation could be used to bond with her?

"Okay," she said, interrupting my train of thought. "This ledger is the only evidence we have, but we need more. We need to break into one of these 'holding facilities' and see if there's something there." She pointed a delicate finger to one address on the page. "This is the closest one. It seems to be a dockside warehouse."

I nodded. "Alright. Let's check it out," I grinned, somewhat more light-hearted than I intended.

Maddie paused, brushing a strand of hair from her face. "The most important thing we can do is act like nothing has changed. If our parents suspect we're onto them, we're in deep trouble."

A disturbing thought appeared in my brain. Was it possible the ledger wasn't fake? Was it possible that both of our parents were into some serious criminal activity? The silliness of it aside, I felt myself deeply conflicted. Should I turn in my own flesh and blood, even if the crimes were true? Would I be able to live with myself knowing that I sent my parents to prison?

I shook my head clear of thoughts. It couldn't possibly be true, and I'll prove it to Maddie by going to one of the supposed 'holding facilities.'

We began to leave the basement, when we heard a curious sound...
11411.title: Dark Secrets

choices: Forget it and head back home
114111.content:
We both stopped short at seeing Maddie's parents stand at the top of the stairs that led into the basement, my mouth going dry as I saw them both frowning with displeasure at the two of us "Maddie, what're you doing down here?" Her father demanded "I told you to keep out of the basement until your mother and I have cleared up the place! The way these boxes are set up, they could fall down and hurt you!"

"I... Uh... I..." Maddie stammered as she went pale, not able to reply without giving herself away somewhat.

Her mother looked towards Maddie and noted the ledger "Oh my..." She said "I think Maddie and her friend have come across our little secret."

I felt my jaw drop at those words. Were they honestly confessing their kidnapping to us?! To my further amazement, Maddie's father looked to the ledger and let out a chuckle "Oh... That old thing. I should have got rid of that when I finished that exercise the FBI."

"The what now?" I asked stupidly, Maddie and me sharing a glance before looking back to the two of them.

"Oh yes, a few years back, the FBI contacted me and your father to work over an idea for them, an investigation into how kidnapping procedures could be run. It was basically how a business like mine could be a front for kidnapping or smuggling on some level. It took a few months and I wasn't supposed to tell anyone that I didn't need to. I kinda just hid that book in here and forgot about it when it was all over a few months back." He looked at us keenly and noticed our expressions "No... You didn't think it was real, did you?"

At our silence, Maddie's parents burst into laughter, only furthering our embarrassment. Maddie pushed her face into her hands and let out a series of whimpers from how she'd been suckered completely accidentally. I too went bright red as the laughter went on and put a hand on Maddie's shoulder as a reminder she wasn't alone in the air of humiliation.

After a minute of hilarity, Maddie's parents calmed down and her father shook his head "You two really are high strung, aren't you?" He asked, still chuckling "Come on, get out of there. If you'd like to go young man, I just need to tell me daughter not to worry about her parents' business ventures and to keep out of places I've told her to avoid."

With a general feeling of relief, me and Maddie stepped out of the basement and I bid her a quick goodbye as she waved back a little miserably. She's probably be in hot water for this but at least her parents had taken it in good humour. I walked out of the house as I was somewhat relieved that that particular adventure had come to naught but stopped walking when I reached the end of Maddie's road and a black car whizzed past me. It turned the corner and sped away towards Maddie's house.

I frowned in thought and wondered just what was up with the car. It seemed a bit odd that it would come up now of all times and the speed it was going at put me on edge. 114111.title: Maddie's parents, looking somewhat displeased!

1141111.content:
The sense of relief I had felt was quickly replaced by worry once again. A speeding black car, with tinted windows, and obscured, out-of-state license plates? Heading right to Maddie's house? It seemed a bit too convenient for my liking. While I wasn't really looking forward to getting humiliated by Maddie's parents again, I needed to check out what the hell that car was doing at her place. I carefully wandered back down the street, looking as nonchalant as I could.

"If they ask why I'm coming back, I'll just say I forgot something," I told myself. They'd probably all have a good chuckle at my expense... again... but at least it would put my mind at ease. I was certain that Maddie would appreciate it. As long as she wasn't being grounded, or something.

Maddie's house came into view, and I suddenly felt the need to hide behind some bushes. Call it instinct, but it seemed like the right call. Peering over the shrubbery, I noticed that the black car was indeed parked right in front of Maddie's house. Strangely, it had backed into the driveway, and the trunk was popped open. A man in a pinstripe suit stood in front of the driver's seat, looking rather displeased. He had dark skin and a thick beard, and his head was neatly shaven. Designer sunglasses completed the look.

All business, I thought. I was trying to remember what Maddie's dad had said. The Feds had contacted him? How odd... considering I thought that he was in the flower delivery business. What would a man who sells plants be contacted by the government? I shook my head. Something didn't add up.

Suddenly, Maddie's garage door opened, and her parents were standing on the inside, waiting for the suited man to approach. They looked remorseful, and there was a brief moment of conversation between them. The suited man made some animated gestures while the parents nodded mournfully. I couldn't hear them, but it seemed to be quite the eventful little talk. There was no doubt that Maddie's parents were the subordinates, however.

It seemed like the suited man ordered Maddie's parents to do something, and they both disappeared into the garage. The man took a quick look around, and then made a gesture to them.

Maddie's mom and dad returned carrying a large sack of some sort. I squinted, and realized with horror what was in the sack... Maddie! Her body was limp inside the material... I assumed that she had been drugged or something, because I saw a twitch or two while she was carried. The three of them gently guided her into the trunk of the black car and then slammed it shut. A few more words were discussed, and then the suited man returned to the driver's seat and drove off. I dived straight into the bushes as he passed.

Still in shock, I took a moment to consider what had happened. I was so dazed that i barely noticed my cell phone was received a text. It was my mom, asking me to hurry home, and be ready for a guest. My stomach churned...
1141111.title: A Black Car and Black Deeds
