11411112.content:
My brain was still reeling from the scene that had just passed. Maddie, my shy, inquisitive childhood friend, had just been stuffed into the trunk of a stranger's car by her parents! Unless this was an elaborate prank of some kind, I had just witnessed a kidnapping. I paused, looked around for a hidden camera, and immediately shook my head. This was real, and my friend was in serious danger. I ignored my cell for now, as it was obviously a trap. I had to investigate Maddie's parents and figure out who the hell the driver was.

Fortunately, I noticed that the garage door was still open. I heard the familiar start-up of Maddie's station-wagon (which had taken us to school for many years), and saw her Dad pull out onto the driveway. Maddie's mom was waiting at the front door, standing with her arms folded. Her Dad gave one last look towards the house, and took off down the street... probably to resume his criminal activities. The bushes continued to give me decent camouflage as he passed.

I studied Maddie's mom as I weighed my options. She had been always a slim woman, but even in recent years she managed to maintain a trim physique. Wearing a baby blue silk blouse and knee-length grey skirt, her legs were rather well exposed and well toned. A dark crop of brown hair framed her face, and she was always wearing a pair of elegant secretary-style glasses. I always found it curious that Maddie looked nothing like her mother. I felt a little guilty for comparing their looks, considering the dire circumstances, but the thought stuck in mind.

Maddie's mom spent a few more moments on her front porch before going back inside. The garage door, still ajar, was my best chance. Timing my sprint carefully, I dashed from the bushes across the front lawn as soon as her back was turned. Ducking under the automated door, I dove behind a pile of old patio furniture.

I didn't hear her scream or yell, so I assumed I had made it safely. I looked around the garage for something that would help me interrogate Maddie's mom. A few spools of rope were hanging against the wall, and a fine-needled garden tool caught my eye. Hopefully Maddie's mom was as ticklish as she was...

I managed to finish tying her ankles together without too much difficulty, trapping them effectively together before I grabbed a hold of her and shoved her roughly down to the floor where we wouldn't be seen by people passing in the street.

Quickly straddling her hips, I glared down at Maddie's mother as she returned the look in kind "Tell me what happened to Maddie!" I demanded "And was what we found in the basement true?!"

"Whatever you're thinking, it's wrong!" She shouted and started to struggle underneath me although I managed to keep on top, gripping my knees against her hips tightly.

"Look Jill." I said, remembering her name finally "I saw what happened earlier with Maddie. She was taken away in a sack! Now tell me what's going on!"

Jill stopped her struggling and for a moment, guilt flooded her face as I mentioned what happened to Maddie. She took a deep breath however and her expression hardened "I have no idea what you're talking about." She said "Maddie's gone out with her father, that's all and if you get off me now, we can forget that any of this ever happened."

I found it hard to believe that she thought I'd fall for that lie but realised she was hardly going to tell me the truth straight off the bat. I locked eyes on her and saw that she wouldn't give up the truth without a fight. Trying to remind myself that this was to find Maddie and I shouldn't really be enjoying it, I lowered my hands down to Jill's sides "You know." With that, I suddenly dug my fingers into Jill's sides, kneading them just below the ribs in a sudden tickle attack. Her arms tried to cover her body but with her wrists tied together as well, she was unable to defend herself very well. I dug into her flanks without mercy, kneading the skin from ribs to hips at a random pace, pulling up her shirt to expose her smooth belly and bare skin underneath. Tickling without the shirt provoked another round of high laughter from Jill and she twitched constantly in a futile attempt to throw me off.

Eventually, I slowed down the tickling while keeping my fingers resting on Jill's smooth belly "Now then, are you going to tell me what I want to know?!"

Jill breathed heavily, her lips still curled up into a smile a little as she looked up at me. Her face was flushed and brown hair stuck to her face from sweat but she soon regained control of herself to answer.

Although I hadn't said I believed her, Maddie sagged in relief, her face lighting up in a smile "Thank you." She whispered before getting off the box she had been leaning against and opened it before pulling out a large, ancient leather tome "I found this after my dad helped clear out an abandoned house for demolition." She said, starting to flick through the pages as I glanced over her shoulder "He knew I had an interest in old books and passed it onto me." She gave a bitter laugh at this point "Although I wish that he'd thrown the thing into a fire."

"Why's that?" I ask, not seeing anything wrong with the book. The letter were in large, Gothic print and although Maddie flicked through it too fast too read, there didn't seem to be anything overtly wrong with it.

"This!" Maddie said as she finally found the page she had been looking for and showed it to me. It was an old style print you got from old books, a picture indicating a bright light in the sky with people bowing down before it. One or two were being plucked up by what appeared to be... tentacles? Seeing Maddie's expression, I decided against to make certain jokes and instead waited for her to go on.

"This book tells of when our town was first founded, that a Cult sprang up to worship a Goddess that had been followed by the old Tribes. They called her T'Calu, the bringer of laughing torment and delight. The Cult was eventually stamped out but not before their Priestess gave a prophecy." Maddie looked down to the page and started quoting directly from it.

"Our defeat is temporary, the Bringer eternal. Await the night's scarlet plume so that the Goddess may break free and rule once more."

She put the book down on a nearby box and looked pleadingly at you "I've been looking into this and found the Priestess was referencing a meteorite that only comes every few centuries and it's passing by Earth over the next few days!"

I listened to Maddie as sympathetically as I could but it all seemed to be an overactive imagination more than anything "Look, Maddie. I think you're getting away with yourself here. You sure you're not just reading far too much into this than you should?"

"No! Not with my dreams!" Maddie blurted out.

"Dreams?" I asked, raising an eyebrow.

"Well... One dream. It's the same one night after night. I'm naked and unable to move and there are these terrible black feathers tickling me constantly! A voice tells me to give in but I won't!" She blushes as she realises what she's just admitted to you but goes on "Look, there's a way I can prove what I'm saying. My shy friend turned away, shaking her head. "I think it's where the old Tribes used to gather for their ceremonies. It may be a site of a portal that allows T'Calu to break through into our world. Or it may simply be the last place the Cult was seen. I don't know."

I closed the book, somewhat alarmed by the few pictures I had seen. I can see why Maddie had been so obsessed with this writing! I was enthralled by it, and only just looked it over.

Maddie was taking a while, but I wasn't too worried. She'd come down when she was ready or yell if she needed anything. More importantly, the tome might've been able to provide some information as to exactly what Maddie expected to find.

I flipped through the pages, looking for something on the original tribesmen who worshipped the goddess. This book was clearly made by the cultists who sprang up after the town was made, but Maddie said that the first worshippers of T'Calu were the natives. Whilst this book was a relic, anything by or about the tribesmen would be helpful.

Then I found the drawing. To be honest it was more of a sketch, but the level of detail was astonishing. In the sketch there was a giant rock in the middle of a forest clearing. The stone was engraved with even more of the crazy pictures, probably of T'Calu and her worshippers. All of them centered around a single eye engraved into the face of the rock, from which carved tentacles wound and weaved outward.

Below it was some mad caption: The Gateway of T'Calu. Here she remains, and here she will rise again when the nightfire burns. Only the truly pious have gone through to visit our goddess, and those who return tell of unending laughter and insatiable lust. Those who do not eagerly await the nightfire, when the gate opens and all in her realm are freed.

Guessing from the paragraph, this was what Maddie was looking for. If not, it was what we were going to find. There was more writing beneath the caption:We believe the Old Ones went through the gate when the settlers first arrived, to escape the guns and slaughter. It explains why we found this site intact, their items and prophecies and relics. They wait on the other side with T'Calu. Occasionally the ghostly form of an Old One graces a congregation bearing the will of T'Calu, but they do not talk outside of our meetings.

The 'Old Ones' must've been the tribesmen that first worshipped T'Calu. According to this insane book, they were on the other side of this gateway rock thingy with their goddess. Creepy, but totally unbelievable. A rock was the portal to another dimension? What were they on?

I kept looking back towards the carving of the eye. Something about it piqued my interest, drawing me in. On the next page was a larger version of it, also with a caption. I read it curiously.

The Eye of Kietelen, T'Calu's manifestation in the mortal world. Very few have been visited by this ethereal creature. Whilst this is her manifestation, it is important to remember that T'Calu and the Eye are two different beings. T'Calu is a goddess, while the Eye is a spiritual ambassador. It looks into you, searches your soul, and gauges how closely you are connected to our goddess.

Even more crazy talk. Still, the eye was very captivating. I wanted to look into it forever, even if it was just on paper. The intricately drawn tentacles were so vivid, the complexity made it look like they were moving. The slitted pupil was so dark and entrancing that even when the eye blinked I was captivated.

Wait, did the eye blink? I inspected it closely, the smell of musty pages filling my nostrils. Having a staring contest with a picture wasn't the smartest thing I've done, but I wanted to make sure that I wasn't going mad. Just as I was about to dismiss it, the eye blinked again... and looked at me.

If I had been able to, I would've jolted and dropped the book. But it was as if I was frozen in solid ice, unable to move a muscle or break my fixated gaze. The Eye of Kietelen's ink tentacles started spindling and writhing while a voice pierced my head. "Your connection to my goddess is incredibly strong" I heard. "She will be most pleased when she meets you in person."

Finally I was in control again, and I snapped the book shut. I stood there a moment, panting, trying to make sense of I'd heard, what the voice told me. Then I spent a few minutes convincing myself it didn't happen, and failing horribly.

"Yes, my dear!" I boomed in the Eye's voice, his will overpowering myself for a moment. "I have awoken the desires of your friend. You should be thrilled! We have chosen you to be the first of many to know our brand of unending laughter!"

Maddie looked completely frantic. "W-Wait! I kn-know what you're gunna do! P-please don't t-tickle me!"

I looked back at her, the Eye's will akin to my own. "It's a bit late for that, Maddie." But the question is, where did I start?

"No! D-Don't tickle me! Please! I'm begging!" Maddie writhed in her bonds, but alas the ropes held tight.

"Soon, dear girl, you will be begging for us to never STOP tickling!" the Eye retorted gleefully as I finished pulling her first shoe off. As delicately as I could, I teased her socked foot, and as I did so Maddie began to produce bubbly laughter along with pleas to stop. Obviously I did not desist my actions, and while I teased her right foot, I slowly pulled off the shoe on her left foot. Down to but socks, Maddie begged for me not to remove them. "Unlikely," I replied evilly, as I stuck my fingers into the sides of the socks, ready to pull them off. Once inside, I began to feel the soft bottoms of Maddie's feet, and suddenly became filled with the urge to see the bare beauties for myself. I pulled them off suddenly to find the bound, soft, pale feet of Maddie, and was overcome with lust. Her feet were long and shapely, thinner but with respectably deep arches with a light pinkish hue. Also apparently, she had recently painted her toenails a light, sky blue.

Knowing by Maddie's recent actions, it was only a matter of time before she had submitted to my actions. So why bother relenting in one spot when she was so close to broken anyway?

"You are wise to never relent, servant", the Eye echoed in my mind. "But this Maddie of yours is perhaps a bit stronger willed than I had imagined. She's coming along slowly."

"There a problem with that?" I asked telepathically, while keeping a light motion on Maddie's toes, pushing her ever closer to true bliss.

"Not exactly, but T'Calu desires her first 'subject' to be broken a bit faster. The more subjects she has, the quicker she can return."

"Understood," I replied, pondering what else I could do to push Maddie beyond her limits and into the grasp of T'Calu. Spying a few ribbons on a dresser near the corner of the room, I suddenly was inspired with what would sure to be the Coup de grâce for any will Maddie had left. I stopped the tickling but for a moment, just to dash over and grab the thin strips of fabric, bringing them back to Maddie's delightful pair of feet. Maddie's laughter and moans began to subside in this cease-fire, turning into quiet grasps for air. It wasn't until she felt the ribbons between her toes did she even try to speak though.

"Wha...What...Now?" she breathed, her chest still aching. I gave the most diabolical grin I could.

"We've decided that your precious little feet had too much wiggle room," I replied, as I bound each toe with the silky, pink ribbons to the bed-frame, with each knot removing any freedom she had in her state. "It's time for you to experience true bliss." I tied the last knot, securing Maddie's smooth pink soles firmly in place. There was nowhere to run any longer.

"Bu...But..." she tried, but without mercy I dove straight back into tickling, the feather tantalizing the tops of her toes while my other hand scratched the delicate soles. She turned directly back to wild laughter, followed by more of the sensual moans of delight. I noticed that her frequency of moans were rapidly increasing, the Eye's magic and my idea combining to turn any will she had into mush. I myself reveled in the delight of turning this once shy, but strong willed girl into a tickle servant, becoming drunk on both the power I had over the situation, and the sensual nature the whole experience gave me. And yet, I felt something tugging in the back of my mind. Memories of what we had planned, the beauty I saw in Maddie no one else did. And I knew, deep down, I had broken not just her will, but her heart as well.

Was this...Something I could live with? Could I carry this choice onward, with no regrets? I felt the ties that bonded even myself to the Eye, could they be broken?

1142111112111.title: I've come too far to back out now!

11421111121111.content:
Without thinking for long, we decided to obey the The Eye's words, in spite of our current bodily longings. We completed our preparations and spent some more time on reading the book before we would have to leave for the bus.

In a later chapter it read "Destruction came over the quiet fields, farms and villages. Dark clouds appeared out of blue sky. The red sister devours crop and roof. Armies of belief wage war on peasants. Only journey over the Great Water to Nieuw Amsterdam saved them. Ours were on board. De kleine Farahilde was de meest kieteligste meisje in de wereld.."

Depicted was a female person, stopped in the middle of doing a cartwheel, with ankles and wrists tied to trees. Feathers zoomed in from all four directions.Maddie jumped when she saw the drawing when she understood where the feathers would go when they met the body. She hugged me tightly. It was time to go.

We went to the bus station by bikes with our equipment distributed into two backpacks. Initially the bus driver was reluctant to drop us off where we asked him to do this because there neither was a bus stop nor was there anything else besides a large forest. When we gave him a few extra dollars he took them, chuckled, mentioned something about two teenagers doing something indecent in the forest and later wondering how to get home. In fact we had forgotten to arrange our return. Luckily the bus had a large cargo department, empty enough for both of our bikes to fit into. Minutes after the bus moved and brought us into an uncertain future.

When we saw the trees become more dense a tingling feeling began to spread. Maddie's grip on my hand go tighter. I looked around. Most people slept, only a few read or listened to music, bored by the endless sea of trees. Minutes after goosebumps appeared on my neck. In my mind the voice was back. "Your bare feet will carry you from here." I went to the bus driver who brought the vehicle to a halt, offloaded the bicycles and drove off, shaking his head. The other passengers did not care. If they had known...

On the other side of the main road we saw a small tarmac side road lead into the forest, blocked by a barrier. We locked the bicycles to a tree hidden from view and went up the side road. After a few meters I remembered the voice, stopped and took off my shoes and socks. Maddie looked at me curiously, but also shed her shoes. After a mile the road reached a black gate, with a fence on each side. Warning signs with severe punishment for each trespasser warned anyone to enter this private ground.

Uncertain what to do we...

Uncertain what to do we were confronted by a guard. The hooded figure came out of the shadows. On his chest a tiny badge with a meanwhile familiar eye met out stare. Without saying any word he motioned us to approach the gate. From up close we saw that he wore a face mask. Only his eyes were signs of a human behind it. "Show me" he said in a low voice. Show him what? I did not want to expose our ownership of the book right at the front entrance. Maddie hit me in my ribs with her elbow and said "Tickle me".

I took one step back. Maddie held both hands tightly to the iron bars of the gate and lifted her right foot. I grabbed it and started to dance my fingers over her sole. The events earlier in the day flashed back to her memory. Instantly she squealed with laughter and started to breath hard, looking directly into the guard's eyes. After a few seconds her already saw enough and opened the gate for us.

The narrow road went up further into the hills. After a few more bends a tiny footpath left to the right, which we followed under the icon of the eye attached to one of the trees. Soon we came onto a clearing where a small crowd of people already gathered. We were surprised to see people of all age groups, talking in small groups. Further apart stood a group of four adults who stood out from the group by their dress and air of seniority. Their heads turned to us. Two of them were indian natives. Although there was some distance I heard one of them say: "They have arrived."

Next...
114211111211111.title: were confronted by a guard

choices: We got on a bus to downtown
The Eye began taking over... and I couldn't stop it
114211112.content:
For a moment, time was frozen. All I could see was Maddie before me, in all her youthful beauty, with a body practically begging to be touched and tickled. The Eye's voice no longer seemed to be a whisper... now it was a urgent yell, demanding that I give in and torment my friend with laughter.

"This one will be the first of many," the Eye of Kietelen said with authority. "The first of your limitless harem. When you join us, you will become the Avatar of T'Calu, The Bringer of Laughing Torment and Delight. The armies of this world will tremble beneath her touch, and you shall be her strongest general, leading the forces of lust. You cannot fight your destiny."

It was a struggle to fight the relentless words, now embedded into my mind. Maddie, as she was, looked at me curiously, with her ivory white skin barely covered by her t-shirt and khakis. The image of the Eye was burned into my vision; with its haunting gaze and swirling tendrils.

Maddie said something, but all I could imagine was the 'limitless harem' now promised to me. Would it be so bad, I wondered, to be the most powerful person on the planet? To lead a Goddess from some distant dimension into our world?

"...let's roll," Maddie said, as my reverie was broken. I nodded, half-aware of where I was. Maddie motioned to her door, and I followed, still somewhat entranced by the Eye's promises.

"It would be so easy," whispered the Eye, staring into me... through me. "To take what is rightfully yours."

I shook my head forcefully. "No," I grumbled under my breath, out of hearing of Maddie. "I will not give in."

If my friend had heard my little conversation, she didn't make note of it.

"Alright, let's grab what we can here and then head downtown to the hardware store. We need to make sure we're prepared for ANYTHING." Maddie said, with as much authority as she'd ever had. I noticed that her personality was shifting since I first arrived. No longer was she Shy Little Maddie. She was slowly becoming a fighter... and perhaps the dark secrets of T'Calu were strengthening her resolve.

I hoped that the experience would strengthen me as well... but the Eye seemed to have taken a keen interest in me. I tried to suppress it as I kept up with Maddie out the front door.
114211112.title: The Words of the Eye

choices: I immediately left for the Gateway
11421112.content:
As I closed the basement door behind me, I turned and saw someone standing there, looking at me. Whoever it was, they wore a brown hooded cloak that encompassed their entire body. The shadow cast by the cowl of their hood hid most of their feautures, but I could see their mouth move as they spoke.

"The Eye has informed our goddess of your connection to her," I was told. The voice was obviously female, but that was all I had to go own because of the cloak. "She would like to invite you to her realm, that she may communicate to you directly."

My mind was bubbling with questions, but one was more important than any other. "Where's Maddie?" I asked her. "What did you do to my friend?"

The woman bowed her head. "She is with us, and will stay in our until you visit our Lady T'Calu. Your friend is close to the truth, and would seek a way to prevent the return of our goddess. It can be done, which is why we are keeping her with us for now."

Maddie was taken, captured by the cultists. I felt worried about her, angry that these people kidnapped her, scared as to what they might do to her. "Leave her alone," I threatened vehemently.

"There is no need to worry," the woman unsuccessfully reassured me. "She will not be harmed or touched if you make haste to the Gateway."

She turned to leave, but I had another question. "If the this can be stopped, why tell me that? I was in the same boat as Maddie in the first place, what makes you think I won't try to stop T'Calu's return?"

Her mouth gave a slight smile. "Because you have the desire, unconscious or not, to meet T'Calu. You want to see her realm, you want to meet her in person. And she wants to meet you."

I didn't know about that, but I had to take a course of action, for Maddie's sake.
11421112.title: An Invitation

114211122.content:
I tried following the cultist, but she almost literally disappeared into thin air. As she turned and left, her form slowly dissapated until there was no proof of her existence at all. Whoever these people were or whatever they were capable of, it was clear that on some level the powers of this religion were real.

A quick search of the house confirmed what the cultist had said. Maddie was nowhere inside, and I very much doubted she left on her own. If she was really being held captive by these lunatics, I had no choice but to visit the Gateqay of T'Calu.

I leapt into the backyard, scaled the fence into my house, burst into the garage and grabbed my bike. It was the fastest and most private way to get to the forest. Although it might have been smart to tell somebody else about where I was going, something told me - figuratively - that doing so would break my promise to the cultists.

The book on the cult was still under my arm. I thought about ditching it, but decided that I would probably need it once I got to the forest, if only to find my way to the rock. My backpack opened and the tome slipped in, fitting alongside some supplies I keep in my bag for emergency trips like this.


Fifteen minutes saw me at the edge of the forest, looking into the thick underbrush, trying to find any point of reference. I was on the edge of town, at the end of a deserted street, ironically a few meters away from the abadoned house where Maddie's dad found the book. The place was as empty as empty could be.

The forest itself was a whole other story. There might not have been anything moving, but the woodland was full of trees and branches and bushes and flowers and moss and general plant life. Healthy green vegetation was a good sign that the forest was vibrant and alive, though maneuvering was going to be difficult.

After chaining my bike to a nearby fence, I considered my next move. Instinct was yelling at me to go in alone; I had the book, and I was fast enough to bolt if worst came to worst. But logic told me that having someone along would be better.

In the end I decided to...
114211122.title: Edge of the Unknown

choices: Everywhere the plants came to life, writhing and reaching
The Eye of Kietelen looked at me and opened the Gateway
1142111221.content:
Having someone else along with me would've increased my chances of getting out okay, but who would believe me? I was going through a portal to another dimension to meet a pagan goddess so I could get Maddie back from a cult of ghosts that was stamped out ages ago. It was gonna be a tough sell, no matter who I told it to.

In the end, I decided going alone on this one was the best course of action. Of course, I had no idea how to proceed. The only thing I knew about the location of the Gateway was that it was in middle of a clearing somewhere in the forest. With no clear path to follow, I was stumped.

There had to be some indication as to where the clearing was. The cultists had found it after all, and if people went to visit it then there had to be some trail that led the followers to the rock. Leafing through the old tome I brought from Maddie's, I quickly found the page about the Gateway again. Apparently there was a path leading there when the cult was strong, but it must've been overgrown during the many decades of misuse.

Frustrated, I put the tome back in my bag and scanned the treeline for something. The woman said that I shoukd make to the Gateway with haste, so she was expecting me to at least find it. After about a minute of searching, I found what I was looking for.

Carved into the trunk of a tree close to the edge of the forest was the Eye of Kietelen. The vertical pupil stared straight ahead, surrounded by its tentacles or vines or whatever. Approaching it, I studied the area around the tree, looking for what once was a path. It made no difference - I found nothing.

Getting even more exasperated, I returned to the carving of the Eye. This was getting me nowhere, and every second I delayed meant another second Maddie spent with these insane psychopaths. There just had to be a way to find the trail.

Again, as before, the Eye of Kietelen looked at me from its wooden face. This time I wasn't as shocked, but it still surprised me to see the solid wood move. Then some mad notion entered my head: what if I asked the Eye? Quickly, I buried the thought. This was a tree, I was letting my imagination get the better of me, I was desperate. But I was desperate. I had nowhere to go, and this might've been my only lead.

Resigning to the insanity, I turned to the Eye and asked "How do I find the Gateway of T'Calu?" For a moment nothing happened, and I cursed myself for a fool. But then the Eye looked down, and when I followed its gaze I saw the undergrowth slowly drawing back, clearing a way to enter the forest. Bushes bent away, moss shrunk back, all the plants simply moved.

When it was done, there was a clear and obvious trail through the forest.

I stared at the plants, and for a second considered bolting. Whatever was at play here it was bigger than me. But then I remembered Maddie, how I doubted her and thought her crazy for believing this. I owed her, and so I pushed forward into the wood.

Normally a walk through the forest would have me admiring the beauty of nature, trying to identify the trees and listening for bird calls. Not that time. I was all business, marching through the thick forest, trying to get to my destination. I passed several Eyes of Kietelen on my journey, each one watching me as I passed through. I had no doubt that T'Calu knew I was coming.

Upon entering the clearing, I immediately recognized the Gateway. It looked more or less just like the one in the sketch I found, with the huge Eye of Kietelen staring forward. The markings were all either pictures of worshippers or letters in a long-forgotten alphabet. The clearing itself looked different from the sketch, as much of it had been overgrown. Nature's grip was growing stronger. But not a single plant grew on the rock, despite the rampant vegetation eveywhere else.

Gathering my wits, I announced to the Gateway "Here I am, now what do you want me to do?" For a tense moment, all was still.
1142111221.title: Clearing the Way

choices: I gave in to the desire
I resisted and left the realm
11421112212.content:
As before, the Eye looked at me, its vertical pupil shifting on the rock. The appendages behind it started moving, but unlike the pointless wriggling of the previous pictures the tentacles were actually moving the various drawings and words, arranging them.

Once again, the Eye's voice entered my thoughts. "Greetings mortal. I see that T'Calu's first worshippers have forced your hand in a sense. Fear not, your friend is safe and untouched. She is in the personal care of our great goddess."

"No one's done anything to her?" I stressed. If Maddie went through torture because I left her alone, I'd never be able to forgive myself. The Eye's sincerity was disarming though, as if it were personally meeting me on even grounds.

"As I said, untouched," the Eye reiterated. "We will not violate your friend, especially since you are so useful. Enter my goddess' realm, she awaits your arrival. Actually, she's very excited to meet you."

The Eye finished arranging the carvings, which made the general shape of a doorway on the face of the rock. Shining brightly with a bright white light, the Eye of Kietelen's pupil expanded until in encompassed the entire portal, creating a glowing gateway to T'Calu's realm.

Hesitantly, I stepped towards the doorway. There was no way to tell where I was going to end up when I entered, or even if it was a trap. But as before when I was conflicted about asking the Eye, I had little choice. So when I arrived at the portal, I quickly made two steps and went through.

T'Calu's realm was a bit duller than I had pictured it. All around me was a light blue haze shooting by me as I tunneled towards my destination. I had no idea where that was, but I suspected that the goddess was directing my journey through her dimension.

Focusing on what I could see, I changed my analysis of her realm. It wasn't like looking into a blue haze, it was like looking past a thick veil. Beyond I could see vague forms in various positions doing various things, but it was all too fuzzy for me to really make out what they were doing or who they were. Though I did have a hunch. I was beginning to think that this was the majority of her realm, where the cultists and natives existed. If that was the case, T'Calu was bringing me somewhere private.

Soon I was slowing down, entering another part of the dimension. The veil thickened gradually until all I could see was white, and that was when I landed. At least it felt that way, but I couldn't see what I was standing on. Everywhere was white. Then I felt a presence push against my consciousness. At first I thought it was the Eye, but this voice was distinctly feminine.

"Come to me."

I had really no idea where to go, but the same presence that spoke was also pulling me somewhere. All I did was follow the direction, and sure enough a dark speck appeared seemingly out of nowhere, rapidly growing until it became a room. Reality was weird here.

The place was akin to a dungeon, just with much more expensive and comfortable restraints and more lushly decorated. Black and violet was the main color scheme to the room, projecting a dark yet soothing atmoshphere. In the center was a collection of rich furniture, probably where the goddess would meet people, and the dim lamps were stationed regularly across the three walls.

When I neared the sofa, I felt the presence from before return. "Sit," the voice instructed. Suspecting that it was in fact T'Calu, I hastily obeyed. No sooner did I lean into the sofa then a woman materialized instantly right beside me. Her sudden appearance startled me, causing me to recoil a little bit. Who else could it be but T'Calu herself? Once I recovered, I took a good look at the goddess

Her hair was as smooth and black as ebony, the same as her eyes. Staring into them made me think of black holes, sucking in everything, even light. Her skin was a deep violet, and her voluptous body had curves in all the right places. As if that weren't enough, she wore no more than a black lace bra and a short miniskirt that barely covered anything, showing off her hips and bosom.

She was the epitome of sexy. I could see how she representented maddening lust.

"So nice to finally meet you," she greeted, a thin forked tongue slithering out of her mouth. In person, her voice was rich and seductive. "Ever since my Eye of Kietelen spotted you I've been waiting for this. Your spirit, your connection to myself is unique in a way I have never seen before. I'm anxious to get to know you better."

Wanting to make sure, I quickly asked "Where's Maddie?"

T'Calu pouted, her lip stuck out in a strangely endearing expression. "Why? Am I not enough for you?" she asked flirtatiously, shifting closer to me across the couch. I did my best to stay focused on finding Maddie, but my hormones were focused solely on this voluptous beauty in front of me.

"I came because your followers took my friend."

"Don't worry, she was returned to your world when you arrived in this realm," T'Calu informed me. "I only wanted to talk with you, it was never my intention to harm you or your friend."

Taken aback, I found myself at a loss for words. Previously I was under the impression that they were going to hold Maddie hostage until I did what they wanted. Now that they had already let her go, that made this a completely even-footed meeting - that is, apart from the fact that she was a goddess who controlled the dimension I was sitting in.

"If you're going to ask me to help you enter our world, the answer is no."

Underground city? Try underground citadel.

Instead of a fourth wall, the 'room' we were in opened up to an absolutely massive cavern and a wide flight of stairs leading down into the temple-city. Towering structures and proud spires stuck up from the rocky floor, with detailed carvings and beautiful engineering obviously displayed in the many structures. There were streets, courtyards, plateaus, even fountains this far beneath the surface. Sand covered the spaces unevenly, giving it an abandonded look. Everything was lit up by a yellow glow that lit up from lines around the city, as if powered by energy that wasn't electrical. Then again, a magical explanation at this point would've been probable.

The layout of the city itself reminded me of the Arc de Triomphe in Paris; like spokes from a wheel, there were six streets that shot out of a ringed road in the center of the city. Within the ring was a huge domed structure, not unlike the Pantheon in Rome, though it was much larger and much more decoratively designed. Maybe this was the original inspiration. A second look confirmed what I thought: the glowing yellow lines that flowed throughout the city all began from the domed temple, in the middle of the dome.

"Whoa," was all I could manage.

"Yeah whoa," Maddie quipped back. "Nice plan and all, but how are we even going to find the Orb of Ethereal in this place?"

She had a point. There was a lot of ground to cover if we were going to search from building to building, no way we were going to finish in a week let alone three days. Then again, considering the planning that went into this design, we may not have had to.

"It's there," I said with absolute certainty, pointing at the domed temple in the middle of the citadel.

She looked at me skeptically. "How do you know?"

Instinct was yelling at me I was right, but it was more than just a gut feeling. Logic was on my side to. "Think about it," I said. "Whoever planned this put a lot of thought into making it look grand. If that's the case, then you don't just stash the Orb in some random house, you place it on a shrine that demands attention. And since the orb is the centerpiece of the magic here, why wouldn't it be in the central temple?"

After a few moments of deliberate thought, Maddie gave in. "That makes sense," she admitted, "and we have to start somewhere."

With a plan of action in mind, we started descending the unbelievably long flight of stairs into the city. Little did we know that something was going to interrupt our progress.
11421112212211.title: Desert Expedition

choices: Maddie threw me in the fountain, scattering the bugs.
The bugs targeted the rest of me too, slowing our progress.
114211122122111.content:
Funny how distances look so much shorter from higher ground. As soon as we reached the bottom of the stairs (the climb took all of fifteen minutes) we were dwarfed by the immense structures that lined the road. Since this was an old world city there was no such things as sidewalks, but the ruts made from carts were still visible even after thousands of years.

While most of the damage came from the ages, it was clear that the descent into the desert took its toll on the city. Grains of rock were piled unevenly across the street and in the buildings, some of which were full of sand, acting like a windowless container.

Behind us, a large cluster of bugs flew around and slowly headed towards us, its buzzing softer than our ears could pick up at that distance. We didn't know they were there, but they knew we were there, as did every creature in the city by now. Deciding now was a good time to strike, the swarm flew quickly towards its first victim.

Suddenly, we heard an ominous buzzing noise, as we turned around we saw a throng of what looked like miniature scarabs. Each one was no bigger than a fly, but there were so many that I couldn't fit them all in a jar if I tried. Maddie screamed at the sight of the bugs and we quickly turned and dashed in a mad attempt to outrun the swarm.

"What are those things?" she asked frantically, pushing herself harder than she evr had before.

"Whatever they are, we know what they're going to do, and we don't have the time! Let's split up and see if they follow both of us, if not maybe something in this book will help whoever's free get rid of them."

Nodding in agreement, Maddie quickly ran right while I veered to the left. The swarm adjusted course accordingly, altering its direction so that it closed in on me quickly. Once it was apparent I was their target, I turned back to Maddie who had stopped running and was watching me.

"The book!" I shouted, throwing it over. The tome was heavy, but my strength was something I could be proud of and the dense pile of paper sailed over and landed at Maddie's feet.

"I got it!" she yelled back, but I couldn't hear because the buzzing had already caught up with me. A cricle of flying scarabs trapped me, leaving me with no escape as I looked at the wall of black insects. The pause was excruciating, as if the scarabs were taking a moment to savor their catch. It easn't the tickling I feared, it was how much time we'd waste with these things.

Slowly, it began. A small detachment of bugs buzzed towards me, climbing over my face and neck. The light teasing wasn't much, but it kept me on edge. Some crawled behind my ears, caressing the sensitive skin there, while others annoyed my nostrils. I tried to swat them away, but they moved far too fast.

Then more of the swarm joined in, approaching my spastic body. They buzzed around my torso, looking for skin to tickle but finding nothing but cloth. For a second I thought I'd won, but then a new sensation pressed into my skin that elicited a slight giggle.

Looking down, I saw what was causing it. The bugs, frustrated that I wasn't unclothed, decided to make me so. Each scarab used its tiny mandibles to tear tiny holes in my quickly vanishing t-shirt. Alone, a few scarabs would take minutes to finish the job, but this was a swarm. My shirt lasted seconds at best, torn to shreds faster than I could take it off. Soon after my backpack hit the fround, the straps which held it eaten through.

Immediately I burst out laughing. With my shirt gone and effectively destroyed, there was nothing stopping the bugs from crawling all over my defenseless torso. Their little legs were covered in prickly bristles, tickling my belly and ribs tremendously. One even climbed into my navel, forcing peals of laughter from my lungs as I fell to the ground. It only got more intense when the bug tried to fly out, its wings brushing the walls of my deep belly button.

Faintly from beyond the buzz, I heard Maddie shouting something. "Water!" I heard. "The bugs hate water!"

Now we knew how to get rid of them, but I was in no condition to go anywhere. Realizing this, Maddie took the plunge and burst through the ring of bugs, helping me up and together making our way to the closest fountain.
114211122122111.title: Seek and Tickle

choices: We made it to the domed temple.
1142111221221112.content:
Though my upperbody was being relentlessly teased by the bugs, with Maddie's support I was able to walk without too much difficulty. For some reason the swarm seemed to focus on me and leave Maddie largely alone, though occasionally one crawled into her sweater and elicited a few giggles from her. Maybe this was some form of T'Calu's spite, that I refused her offer.

We were almost at the fountain when it happened. The swarm, as if realizing our plan, doubled their efforts to slow me down. All of the remaining scarabs buzzing around us flew towards my shorts and sandal straps, beginning to eat away at the material. Pretty soon they both had been torn to smithereens as well, leaving me in nothing but my boxers.

Then they attacked. Bristly legs started brushing and climbing all over my legs, up and down my inner thighs, behind my knees, even the tops of my feet. The maddening touches sent me into new fits of laughter, and I fell to the ground unable to walk while the scarabs tickled my legs.

Doing so was a mistake however. As soon as my feet left the ground, the scarabs began crawling all over my soles. My arches, my heels, my insteps, even my toes all got the same tickly treatment as the rest of my body. I had begun to laugh silently, air forced out of my lungs as I kicked my legs in a futile attempt to dislodge the bugs.

Frantically, Maddie tried to brush the bugs of my legs so that we could keep going, but whenever she did the bugs just started crawling onto her, going in her sleeves while she shook them out. Then she had a horrible idea. As she tried to wipe the scarabs off of my feet, her fingernails accidently brushed some of my soles, tickling tremendously more than the bugs. She kept doing it for a while, and I thought she may be enjoying herself.

As for me, I couldn't think too much about the situation. Too many ticklish thoughts filled my brain for me to really analyze it. To be honest it was quite a fun experience, but the time limit always sat nagging in the back of my mind, and for that reason we couldn't afford to go through too many of these encounters.

Finally feeling that she was doing more harm than good, Maddie resigned to grabbing my ankles and dragging me across the sandy street. It was quite a scene, a teenage girl dragging a near-naked hysterical boy across the street, but then again today wasn't an average day.

When Maddie dropped my legs, I noticed vaguely that we were by a fountain. It was a small one, the semicircular pool protruding from the building with the water pouring a snake's head a couple feet above the ground. Already the bugs were getting nervous, which made them scamper around my skin even faster.

It was difficult for her, but Maddie managed to lift me by my arms and kind of drag me into the fountain. Wherever the water touched me the scarabs buzzed away even more quickly than they came, dispersing far away from the liquid. When finally my feet entered the cooling pool, the last of the bugs fled, leaving me to recover in peace.

A minute later, I sat up, soaked to the bone. While I was down, Maddie had retrieved both the book and my strapless backack, leafing through the tome and reading about the city and - more importantly - the creatures in it. She saw me rise, and she extended a hand to help me up.

"You okay?" she asked.

"Yeah, wasn't actually that bad," I reassured her, taking her hand and lifting myself up. "Did you enjoy tickling my feet?"

"Wha-what? I wasn't - I was trying to help you," she stammered, her cheeks blushing furiously.

"Admit it," I prompted. "You liked it, even if it was accidental at first. I noticed how you didn't stop, and I know you're bright enough to see when an idea isn't working."

Maddie had no answer except to hide her face with her hair, cheeks reddening. She knew I was right, and she didn't know what to think about her unexpected pleasure of tickling me. Letting the subject drop, I stepped out of the fountain and rested an arm around her shoulders, pulling her in for a hug.

When she pulled away, her cheeks were still red. Following her eyes, it was my turn to blush as I remembered that the scarabs had torn all my clothes except my now drenched boxers. I looked over to the shreds of my shorts and shirt, as well as my now strapless sandals. They were all worse than useless now.

"Oh yeah," I said. Really it wasn't that uncomfortable for me - people have seen me wearing less - but with Maddie as reserved as she was the entire situation was awkward.

"We-we should keep moving," she said, clamping the book into her chest and pushing forward, still blushing furiously. Lifting my bag by one of the torn straps, I followed dutifully. Both of us were determined to reach the dome before we were interrupted again.
1142111221221112.title: Interference

choices: We went down the feather passage
We went down the sandstorm passage
11421112212211122.content:
It's amazing how much time passes when you're sightseeing. Sometime during our journey, Maddie regained enough of her confidence to stop hugging the book and start reading it. Whether she found anything helpful or not I didn't know, but whatever she found caught her attention as she was shortly deeply engrossed in the book. As for me, I looked around the abandoned citadel we were traveling through, looking at the magnificent and majestic buildings that stood tall and proud, decorated with carvings and balconies and stone statues. The architecture reminded me strongly of some Turkish and Arabic styles, with a hint of Roman on some of the statues and fountains.

Apparently both of us were so enraptured by our thoughts that we almost literally ran right into the enormous temple. The entire thing was circular save for the entrance, which had the square opening barred by stone pillars much in the style of Roman or Greek architecture. The outside was relatively simple save for some friezes wrapped around the walls and a series of mosaics depicting various... ticklish scenarios.

Maddie just stood there for a second, looking up at the massive structure in awe, then her gaze met mine and I saw a shadow of doubt pass over her face. I'm sure I wasn't the most reassuring figure standing there in my boxers, but I did my best to smile and comfort her that way. A ghost of a smile tugged at her lips. "You ready?" she asked timidly.

"If you are," I replied, walking up and resting a hand on her shoulder like I would whenever I convinced her to do something incredibly stupid with me. It happened pretty often, but nothing I've ever done was as crazy as what we were doing that day. Together, we entered the large domed temple, unsure of what we'd find.

Inside was a large open space lavishly decorated with wide couches and low-lying bed-like furniture. Short tables were also scattered around, covered in sand and empty goblets and plates. The room looked like it was once a grand foyer or something to that effect, maybe a relaxation lobby while people tried to get inside. Whatever was inside, it must've been popular as there was enough to easily sit hundreds of people. The empty tableware created a completely deserted atmosphere, much like those western ghost towns where everything's still there, except this was considerably older than the western frontier in America.

Towards the back was a balcony overlooking the space, similarly furnished and similarly deserted. Two straight stone staircases led up to it on either side of the room, allowing easy access. In the center of the back wall, below the balcony, was a tall and wide door about a third of the size of the front entrance. At one time it might have been lit marvelously, and I could see the braziers lining the hall, waiting to be lit. Only it had been centuries since a flame had found this place, the only light coming from the glowing strips of light outside.

"Only one way to go," I said, taking the lead and tentatively stepping into the dark corridor.

"The Orb of Ethereal is placed in a chamber at the top of the temple, in the dome," Maddie informed me. "Only the High Priests of T'Calu were allowed to enter, and many traps were set up along the way for those who didn't belong. We should watch our step."

"Good advice," I told her, now keeping my eyes on the clay-colored floor. A thought struck me, and after fishing around in my backpack I pulled out a good old flashlight. "Do you want this?" I asked Maddie, who nodded appreciatively as she took it and turned it on, shining it deeper into the building. It was nice to actually see where we were going.

Before long we came to a fork in the road. Two passages we could take to continue, each one with a carving in the wall that suggested what might be further down the path. It was like one of those bad adventure movies where the hero has to make a choice based on a carving, chooses the wrong one, then performs a stunning acrobatic feat and avoids falling into a lethal trap, then continues on like a badass. The traps for me and Maddie probably weren't lethal, but neither of us were astonishing acrobats. If we chose the wrong passage, chances were we'd fall right into the trap.

"I don't know which one we should pick," Maddie said helpfully. "Neither look very good."

One hallway was marked with a feather and the other with a twisting funnel of sand like those cartoon sandstorms. The obvious thought would be that the feather was a trap and we shouldn't go that way, but then again tickling was the entire focus of this religion. It'd be what they strive to achieve. Also the Eye of Kietelen's last words before we left stirred something; 'be on the lookout for the Guardian of the Sands' is what he said. Perhaps the sandstorm meant that the guardian was in that direction and we should avoid it, like avoiding the Minotaur in the labyrinth.

To be honest, I didn't have a damn clue as to which way we should go. A flipped coin would've worked just as well as my guess.
11421112212211122.title: Temple Delving

choices: Maddie, after nearly an hour of searching, found me...
The sorceress who had set the feather on me returned...
114211122122111221.content:
"This way," I told Maddie with much more conviction than I felt. Hoping I wasn't making bad call, I tentatively took the lead down the barren passage, keeping my eyes on the ground. We kept going, and the more time that passed the more confident I was that I had chosen correctly. Not a crack in the floor suggested that this was a trapped corridor, and I inwardly breathed a huge sigh of relief.
         "Okay, if we haven't run into a trap yet we probably-"
         I was caught of mid-sentence with the sensation that I was falling. My back pack had landed on the ground above me as a chute just big enough to fit me opened seemingly out of nowhere. Behind me, Maddie screamed and started calling my name. It happened so fast that I didn't even have time to react until Maddie's shouts were a distant whisper, and by then nothing I could have said would have made a lick of difference. All I could do was let the chute take me wherever it led and mentally kick myself for not paying attention.
         Not a minute later the chute flattened out and I landed with a thud on the sand. Mourning the dull pain in my backside, I tried to look around the room. Unfortunately the yellow strips of light that were outside didn't line the room, leaving me in complete darkness. My other senses weren't very helpful either; I couldn't hear anything save my own breathing, and my sense of smell wasn't sharp enough to pick up anything nearby.
         Then, out of the blue, I felt incredibly exhausted and spent, My body did not want to move another muscle, despite my best efforts to stay focused. My mind was cloudy, all thoughts being pushed aside to make room for one that was not my own: sleep. Every part of my body yelled and craved for it, even though I knew I should press forward and find a way out. I took a step and immediately collapsed onto the sand. Everything was so difficult now. I couldn't go anywhere like this. As much as I didn't want to, I had to sleep, otherwise I wouldn't be able to do anything. So what if I just close my eyes, put my head down on the sand for a second. The nice comforting sands, beckoning to me, calling me to sleep...

         I jolted awake, only to find that I could barely move. A quick full-body squirm told me everything I need to know about how I was restrained: from my rear to my elbows was a bench or chair or whatever, over which my arms were tied over the end so my underarms were completely exposed. My ankles were also tied to the supporters, forcing my legs to either side and my feet off the ground. Just being in such a vulnerable position made my cock twitch, which brought to light that I no longer had the privilege of my boxers.
         There was no way this happened naturally because of my sleepwalking, nor could any of the traps likely been intricate enough to expose me so thoroughly. Someone had stripped and tied me, and whoever they were would be back. The question was, why leave me?
         Slowly but surely, some yellow light brightened from the edges of my vision. I turned my head, one of the few things I could move, and saw on the floor something begin to glow with the same yellow light that lined the streets outside. Once my eyes had adjusted, I recognized the shape. The object was a feather, glowing somewhat dimly in the otherwise completely dark room. A yellow outline seemed to glow faintly, giving the feather a look of gold.
         Then, to my astonishment, the feather began to rise of its own volition. Nothing was holding it, nor was it attached to any rope and string I could see. My gaze was fixated on it as it traveled over to my vulnerable form, slowly swimming through the air. The more I thought about it however, the more it made sense with the rest of this nonsensical day. Of course the traps wouldn't just be simple like a pitfall or a chute, it had to be magical. Though a gut feeling told me this wasn't part of the trap.
         Drifting down to my armpit, the deliberate feather never paused and went straight to teasing the exposed flesh with its soft bristles. Immediately I was thrashing myself and trying to escape, the incredibly ticklish feelings shooting across my underarm. Despite my attempts to escape, the caress of the feather was one that I craved for and this one seemed to do its job a thousand times better than any other that had been used on me. Already I felt my loins begin to stir. As I laughed to my heart's content, the feather appeared to glow brighter as it continued its work. The tip traced delicate circles in my hollow, sending me into hysterics. Deathly ticklish is what my many ticklers describe me as. Even this single feather had me laughing incessantly, flailing as far as able.
         The longer I laughed, the brighter the feather glowed until it was shining with bright golden light, at which point it began to rise above my body. When it got so bright I had to squint, I saw another piece of magic that surprised me at first then sort of fell into line with the rest of what I'd seen. When the light died down, there were two identical feathers floating before me, back to dimness of the first time. Somehow the feather had duplicated a completely identical copy, and as the original (though it could've been the copy for all I know) went back to my underarm its counterpart joined in teasing my other one. Now I was a step further along the road to mania, my laughter and struggling increased as both my armpits got equal amounts of due torture. The feather bristles gently grazed my hyper-sensitive flesh, twirling in mad circles or tracing shapes in my taught hollows as I tried in vain to escape their pleasurable touch.
         Before long they were glowing again, and when they rose I looked away this time to avoid being blinded. As I suspected, when I swiveled my head back around I saw four feathers, each one with the faint golden light and completely identical to each other. No time was wasted as two returned to my armpits, giving them the same tickly treatment they'd been receiving for the last few minutes. The new pair had skipped the rest of my body and went straight for my feet, dipping below my vision. Touches of electricity sparked through my soles as the feathers glided up and down my arches, sweeping their bristles across my feet. There was practically no wiggle room for my feet as my toes were tied to something on the floor, forcing my feet to stay open and accessible.
         Another minute of near-mania and the feathers shone once more. When they were finished all eight descended without delay, picking out targets and tickling them as if the feather lived their whole lives tickling me. While my armpits and feet were getting their due treatment, the new four went to my ribs and played with those. The tips of each feather danced across my ribs, diving into the crevices and sweeping from my chest to my belly, covering every inch of available skin above my tummy and below my neck. My cheeks were flushed red by now, burning with all the blood that was rushing to them, my mouth frozen in a laughing position.
         As I laughed and laughed and laughed some more, the feathers began to shine. Somewhere among the whirlwind of ticklish thoughts in my head I was able to make the connection that my laughter was powering this feather, which meant the more I laughed the worse it would get. Of course, the worse it got the more I laughed, and my mind went reeling with what that implied.
         Sixteen feathers now preyed on my body, the new ones going to my legs and looking for skin to tease there. A couple entertained themselves twirling behind my knees, earning some leg jolts as I tried to shake them off. Those that were left paid my thighs a visit, sweeping their bristles up and down my taught thighs. Literally shaking with the intensity of these tickles, half of me begged for it to end soon so I could find and help Maddie and the other half begged for it to never end. The thigh feathers traveled from my knee all the way to my groin, being sure to get my inner thigh in their sweeps. The edges of the feathers brushed my genitals as they passed, arousing me even more.
         By now, the light was so blinding that I had to close my eyes and look away else risk burning my retina. When I looked up, I had a moment to find beauty in the thirty two feathers that flew around gracefully in the air, each with its own golden light. There was a certain scenic aspect to it, something that urged be to take a picture or something. It truly was beautiful, though pretty soon I was laughing too hard to care.
         No part of my body went untouched. My belly alone had a squad of feathers tracing shapes and writing letters, sweeping up and down my sides or tickling the soft underbelly area between the pelvis and the belly button. One evil little feather starting spinning right in front of my eyes, then quickly flew over to my tummy and started drilling into my navel, forcing tears to my eyes and sending my to a heavenly hell. But what was far more effective were the feathers playing between my legs. A collection decided it would be fun to gather around and twirl around my ball sack, setting the bundles of nerves there on fire while another few glided up and down my hard-on. One devious feather had fun playing with the tip of my cock, teasing with its bristles the skin at the very top. I struggled as best I could for my instinct's sake, but the feather was able to follow my bouncing tip as if it were locked on.

Somewhere in her realm, I'm sure T'Calu was enjoying herself.
114211122122111221.title: Magical Feathers

1142111221221112212.content:
I can't remember exactly how long I spent there. Time seemed to stretch as the feathers continued their work all over my horribly exposed body, their number in the thousands by the end of the first hour. Along the way, I discovered that they also possessed the ability to change size, a rather ticklish revelation when a whole bunch decided to shrink and make a ring inside my navel, spinning and tickling the walls at speeds faster than an electric saw. Another group did the same to my stiff member, circling around it at similar speeds, making several rings up and down my erection, arousing me as well as tickling me shitless. At one point I began to grow faint, but on the verge of passing out the glow of the feathers extended to my face, and suddenly all signs of fatigue vanished, leaving me ready to experience another round of induced mirth.
         Like I said, I can't remember exactly how much time had passed, but I think it was something like nearly two hours before I heard something besides my own laughter - which was silent more often than not. Bare feet padded on the stone floor, occasionally muffled by the clusters of sand that dotted the building and the entire city. A figure entered my field of vision, but my eyes were so teary that I couldn't make out a single detail. Whoever it was stood there for a long while, watching me in my heavenly hell. It was hard to tell considering that I couldn't see a damned thing, but it seemed that my visitor enjoyed this.
         As I continued to laugh, I realized with a shock that I was no longer being tickled, that the golden glow of the feathers was gone, replaced with a white glow from somewhere above the figure, and the electric sensations coursing through my nerves had stopped. It was still another minute or two before I could actually stop laughing, and even then I was still giggling slightly as the phantom remnants of the soft touches still covered my skin. Blinking away the tears, I took another look at my visitor.
         Smiling at me was a tall woman, exotically clothed and beautifully shaped. A thin gold circlet crowned her head, holding back a waterfall of jet black hair that fell straight down her body like those cartoons of Egyptian women. She wore a sheer white dress that was so thin I could almost see through it, falling all the way to her ankles and exposing two cute small feet. On one of the fingers of her left hand sat a gold ring with a turquoise stone embedded in it, on which was the carving of a feather. Her irises were grey, and in those smiling eyes I sensed a wisdom that had seen far more things than her apparent youth implied.
         "So you are the intruder who fell prey to one of my simplest traps," she said to me in a very rich voice once my giggles had subsided. "You are a terribly ticklish young man with a charming laugh. Watching you being subjected to my feather was most delightful, especially when you tried to squirm away."
         Still gasping and recovering, I could only think of one thing to say. "Who... are... you?" I asked between breaths.
         The edges of her mouth pulled into a grin. "I am Qumsal, Guardian of the Sands. And you are a very ticklish trespasser, victim to the teasing tortures I have in store for you at my leisure, unfortunately for you." As her eyes wandered down my sweaty body, they settled on my soldier, still standing at attention. "Though perhaps unfortunately is not the best word for it."
         Guardian of the Sands. Why did that title sound familiar? The almost two-hour session I had gone through embedded a lot of my recent memories deep inside my brain somewhere. I was exploring a temple with Maddie, I fell into a trap, we were here to... to...
         "There is a trace of T'Calu's essence on you mortal," Qumsal observed, intrigued. "It mingles with your own, intertwining to make something magnificent. You have been to her realm recently, where some of the ethereal residue must have clung to your essence." With her forefinger, she tapped the side of her head while cocking to one side, a classic gesture for thinking. "Ah, you must be the young master who refused to become her harbinger. It is clear why she offered, your mirth essence is quite... marvelous. And you have the cutest reaction to tickling I've seen in a while." She flicked a nail across my hip, earning a jolt and unbecoming squeal for her effort. "I would love to have been your concubine, at your side while you conquered the world..."
         Oh yeah, now I remembered. We were here to stop an insane goddess of eternal tickling from unleashing her armies on the world and filling it with insatiable lust and desire and pleasure, effectively turning every human into a tickle-crazed mindless machine. More specifically, we were here to remove a portal's source of power so it could not open for T'Calu's armies. And now I was caught, leaving Maddie essentially on her own to solve this problem. Not only that, but this woman who had caught me was the Guardian of the Sands, the very being the the Eye of Kietelen told us to avoid and beware. Absolutely terrific.
         "Although I must say, this outcome is just as pleasurable, for me at least. Such a sensitive young master, exposed to whatever teases I desire. You are just so incredibly ticklish, and your reactions are just so captivating!" She took a moment to flutter her fingers across my belly, turning me into a giggling mass of horny jelly again, shaking under her touch. A sort of enraptured gaze washed over her face, an ambrosial fascination with my quivering flesh. Pulling her hands back, she watched me recover for the second time. "And with another source of power for the portal, the process will surely be shortened by a couple days."
         "What are you talking about?" I asked when I was able. "What does 'another source of power' mean?"
         A very sexy chuckle escaped her lips as she held up a white feather, the same feather that had put me through my torturous ordeal for the last two hours I realized. "All magic to do with T'Calu is powered by mirth through tickling. You probably noticed it when this delightful little tool here was going at you. It duplicated each time it reached a certain amount of power. Each duplication required more power, but at the same time there were more feathers to induce more mirth and thus sustain the growing number of feathers. As wondrous as it is, it doesn't just start itself however. I needed to tickle myself with it for a second before it could begin work on you."
         Trying to take my mind off of the image she just pushed into my head, I continued my inquiry. "I thought that everything here was powered by the Orb of Ethereal?"
         "It is," was Qumsal's mind-boggling answer. "The Orb of Ethereal keeps this city going, and will energize the portal once the nightfire burns, but that covers only half of the magic required. Put in basic terms, the Orb provides an essential and root magical power supply. Tools more specific like this feather and the portal require a source of more specialized magic in addition to the base magics as well. The Orb provides the base energy needed to power more potent magic items like portals, and the tickle victims provide the energy specific to tickling."
         My mind was dancing in circles trying to wrap itself around this concept of many types of magic, but I was beginning to understand. There was pure magic like that which the Orb provided, there was mirth magic like that which powered the feather, and more powerful tools like the portals required both kinds.
         "I imagine that T'Calu will want to punish you for refusing her offer, and most probably that punishment will have you kept in a perpetual state of tickling for eternity. I can see the allure, it would be a pleasant way to spend the rest of time..." Unable to resist, Qumsal reached out and lazily dragged her fingers across my exposed ribs, rewarded with a stream of giggles. At my reaction, she smiled almost dreamily and continued the deliberate movement of her digits.
         Despite the distraction, my mind was working quickly. We were running out of time, and we needed all that we could get. If I could only get out of here, then I would perhaps be able to find my way up and more quickly deal with the Orb of Ethereal. The only way out of here however was through Qumsal, and she showed no signs of giving me a chance to escape. Perhaps I could bargain with her, get her to help, but then I didn't exactly have much to offer. Even my clothes were stripped from me. Then, a desperate idea for a bargaining chip formed in my head, and since it was all I had I decided to give it a shot.
         "Ihihihihif yohohohou hehelp mehehehehe yohohohou cahahahan tihihihihihickle mehehehe ahall yohohohou wahahanteehehehe."
         It was desperate, but I had nothing else to offer. In fact, Qumsal was so surprised by my proposition that she actually stopped tickling me. Her eyes focused on my own. "All I want, however I want, wherever I want, whenever I want? That's a tempting offer young master."
         Sensing the clear interest in what I'd said, I quickly confirmed. "Yes, however, wherever, whenever, with whatever. Just help me and Maddie stop the return of T'Calu and my body is yours to be tickled."
         It was obvious Qumsal was considering the offer hard. Apparently, having someone with a cute reaction to tickling meant a lot, or maybe something to do with my essence. I didn't care. With one index finger she tapped her temple in thought, with the other she drew slow and sloppy shapes across my taut belly, keeping me giggling while she pondered.
1142111221221112212.title: Guardian of the Sands

11421112212211122121.content:
"Very well young master," Qumsal said after a minute or two. "I accept your generous offer. Just remember your promise, and I will do whatever you ask of me." As she finished speaking, the rope that had once restrained me so tightly now fell slack, the knots untying themselves in accordance to Qumsal's magic. Finally free of the awkward position, I stood up and stretched as high as I could, relieving the tension in my muscles. Qumsal just couldn't resist and reached her manicured fingers into my armpits, the golden nail polish catching the light. Immediately I burst out laughing and brought my arms down, but as I've discovered many times when the hands are in the underarms it is already too late.

Collapsing to the sandy floor, I did my best to lose Qumsal's questing fingers, but they managed to follow me. I had the willpower to raise my arms as I dropped, relieving my hollows of the devious nails, but the digits just went to work darting around my body and sneaking in a few tickles randomly across my torso: a pinched rib, a poked belly, a scratched side. They weren't outright torturous, but the little teases had me giggling incessantly and jolting every which way in an impossible escape attempt, since I had no way to predict the sorceress' next move. Pretty soon I found myself curled up into a ball on the floor, helpless before the quick attacks of those menacing fingers.

After a few minutes of her fun, Qumsal chuckled and offered me her hand. "Come young master," she said in her rich soothing voice. "We should reunite you with your companion, then together we will make our way to the top of the temple."

I took the offered hand, and after hoisting me up Qumsal smiled warmly at me, and, surprisingly, I found myself smiling back. I'm not quite sure why, but for some reason I was beginning to grow fond of my former tormentor and jail keeper. Admittedly she was strikingly beautiful - I know of a few supermodels who'd kill for a figure like her's - but it was more than an aesthetic attraction that drew me to her. Shelving the thought, I quickly returned my attention to the task at hand.

"Do you have any idea where she'd be?" I asked worriedly. The last time Maddie had seen me I was falling down a trapdoor, following a chute to an entirely different part of the temple. There's no way she'd follow me down, but at the same time she wouldn't abandon me either. She was probably looking for me somewhere in the temple for the last two hours. That's what worried me. She could've been anywhere, looking for me everywhere.

"I can faintly feel her essence," Qumsal told me. "She's somewhere on the higher floors, looking for a way down. I cannot pinpoint her exactly, but it should become easier once we move to her level."

"Good, then let's get moving," I said with conviction. Inwardly, I was impressed at Qumsal's immediate and definite answer, though I suppose having magic helps in situations like these. Leading the way, the nubile sorceress started walking down one of the passageways, a dim ball of white light illuminating just enough for use to see a bit ahead and behind. I followed closely, looking for anything that might be a trap ahead of us. Qumsal seemed to know her way around, but you could never be too careful.

Qumsal interrupted the silence. "Master, may I ask how you first learned of the goddess T'Calu?" she asked. "Her name is not commonly known amongst the people of the modern world, and those who know it only remember her as some fictional idol that insane cultists worshipped. How did you leave your ignorance of the ethereal planes and become introduced to this magical existence?"

"Well," I began, "it started with a book Maddie's parents found. A great big old thing, filled from cover to cover with details about T'Calu and the history of her followers in the new world. It had a whole history about this place, as well as a beastiary of all the known creatures here who serve T'Calu. It came in handy a couple times."

"A book?" Qumsal looked at me quizically. "How did any book from the T'Calu's time survive the ages? The ancient tomes, if left unpreserved, would have decayed centuries ago."

"Yeah, this one isn't atually a tome from T'Calu's age," I explained. "This is more of a collection of pictures and written works gathered by some cultists during the post-colonial era. Some are written interpretations of ancient texts, some pages have pictures of ancient things that few people can understand anymore." I glanced at a particularly conspicuous slab loose slab of stone, but it turned out to be nothing and we walked right by it. "I don't believe it's a proper substitute for any of those old tomes you mentioned, but it's enough to get by in one of these citadels."

"Left," Qumsal remarked, following her own command and turning down the left passage, her floating ball of light only a couple feet from her at any time. "You will have to show me this book when we have finished our work here."

"Maddie has it right now, it's in the backpack I dropped when I fell into the trap." We spent the next few minutes in silence, Qumsal never slowing. She led us up some stairs, past a few more turns, then up another flight of stairs. Roughly ten minutes into our journey, Qumsal stopped without explanation.
11421112212211122121.title: Agreed Upon Terms

114211122122111221211.content:
I paused and looked around at those words, hoping to see Maddie but she wasn't in the corridor we stood in. Just as I went to ask Qumsal where Maddie was, I heard the faint sound of laughter echoing against the stone walls. I started to run towards the source of the sound, Qumsal following me with a look of slight amusement on her face. It didn't take too long to find Maddie, her laughter getting louder and more desperate with each step I took and I found it hard not too smile upon coming across her predicament.

The corridor we had been rushing through had opened up into a small enclave with a statue on either end, both in the shape of woman that looked (Rather unsurprisingly) like Qumsal herself. It seemed that at least one of these statues was a trap however as Maddie was hanging in mid-air, her arms having been grabbed onto by the statue's hands and she had been yanked several feet into the air. The book lay on the ground underneath Maddie as did the tattered remains of her trousers as a second pair of arms had sprouted from the statue's waist and had seemingly Maddie's lover body of her trousers, ripping them to pieces and leaving her clad only in her panties above her ankles and below her hips.

The statue was using this exposure to great effect as the stomach had opened to reveal a stick holding numerous golden feathers, not unlike a very rich looking feather duster, that was currently in the process of tormenting Maddie's cute tush. The feathers rotated at an agonisingly slow pace, taking care to tease and torment as much of Maddie's butt as they could, her thin panties offering little in the way of protection against the plumes brushing up against her highly sensitive ass.
